// AArch64.ResetGeneralRegisters() // =============================== AArch64.ResetGeneralRegisters() for i = 0 to 30 X[i] = bits(64) UNKNOWN; return;AArch64.ResetSystemRegisters(boolean cold_reset);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registers/AArch64.ResetSIMDFPRegistersPC

// AArch64.ResetSIMDFPRegisters() // ==============================// PC - non-assignment form // ======================== // Read program counter. bits(64) AArch64.ResetSIMDFPRegisters() for i = 0 to 31PC[] return _PC; V[i] = bits(128) UNKNOWN; return;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registers/AArch64.ResetSpecialRegistersSP

// AArch64.ResetSpecialRegisters() // ===============================// SP[] - assignment form // ====================== // Write to stack pointer from either a 32-bit or a 64-bit value. AArch64.ResetSpecialRegisters() // AArch64 special registers SP_EL0 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; SP_EL1 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; SPSR_EL1 = bits(32) UNKNOWN; ELR_EL1 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; ifSP[] = bits(width) value assert width IN {32,64}; if PSTATE.SP == '0' then SP_EL0 = HaveELZeroExtend((value); else case PSTATE.EL of whenEL0 SP_EL0 = ZeroExtend(value); when EL1 SP_EL1 = ZeroExtend(value); when EL2) then SP_EL2 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; SPSR_EL2 = bits(32) UNKNOWN; ELR_EL2 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; ifSP_EL2 = HaveELZeroExtend((value); whenEL3) then SP_EL3 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; SPSR_EL3 = bits(32) UNKNOWN; ELR_EL3 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; // AArch32 special registers that are not architecturally mapped to AArch64 registers ifSP_EL3 = HaveAArch32ELZeroExtend((value); return; // SP[] - non-assignment form // ========================== // Read stack pointer with implicit slice of 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits. bits(width)SP[] assert width IN {8,16,32,64}; if PSTATE.SP == '0' then return SP_EL0<width-1:0>; else case PSTATE.EL of when EL0 return SP_EL0<width-1:0>; when EL1 return SP_EL1<width-1:0>; when EL2 return SP_EL2<width-1:0>; when EL3) then SPSR_fiq = bits(32) UNKNOWN; SPSR_irq = bits(32) UNKNOWN; SPSR_abt = bits(32) UNKNOWN; SPSR_und = bits(32) UNKNOWN; // External debug special registers DLR_EL0 = bits(64) UNKNOWN; DSPSR_EL0 = bits(32) UNKNOWN; return;return SP_EL3<width-1:0>;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registers/AArch64.ResetSystemRegistersV

// V[] - assignment form // ===================== // Write to SIMD&FP register with implicit extension from // 8, 16, 32, 64 or 128 bits. V[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64,128}; integer vlen = if IsSVEEnabled(PSTATE.EL) then VL else 128; if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _Z[n] = ZeroExtend(value); else _Z[n]<vlen-1:0> = ZeroExtend(value); // V[] - non-assignment form // ========================= // Read from SIMD&FP register with implicit slice of 8, 16 // 32, 64 or 128 bits. bits(width) AArch64.ResetSystemRegisters(boolean cold_reset);V[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64,128}; return _Z[n]<width-1:0>;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registers/PCVpart

// PC - non-assignment form // ======================== // Read program counter. // Vpart[] - non-assignment form // ============================= // Reads a 128-bit SIMD&FP register in up to two parts: // part 0 returns the bottom 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits of a value held in the register; // part 1 returns the top half of the bottom 64 bits or the top half of the 128-bit // value held in the register. bits(64)bits(width) PC[] return _PC;Vpart[integer n, integer part] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert part IN {0, 1}; if part == 0 then assert width < 128; returnV[n]; else assert width IN {32,64}; bits(128) vreg = V[n]; return vreg<(width * 2)-1:width>; // Vpart[] - assignment form // ========================= // Writes a 128-bit SIMD&FP register in up to two parts: // part 0 zero extends a 8, 16, 32, or 64-bit value to fill the whole register; // part 1 inserts a 64-bit value into the top half of the register. Vpart[integer n, integer part] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert part IN {0, 1}; if part == 0 then assert width < 128; V[n] = value; else assert width == 64; bits(64) vreg = V[n]; V[n] = value<63:0> : vreg;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registers/SPX

// SP[] - assignment form // ====================== // Write to stack pointer from either a 32-bit or a 64-bit value.// X[] - assignment form // ===================== // Write to general-purpose register from either a 32-bit or a 64-bit value. SP[] = bits(width) value X[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {32,64}; if PSTATE.SP == '0' then SP_EL0 = if n != 31 then _R[n] = ZeroExtend(value); else case PSTATE.EL of when return; // X[] - non-assignment form // ========================= // Read from general-purpose register with implicit slice of 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits. bits(width) EL0 SP_EL0 = ZeroExtend(value); when EL1 SP_EL1 = ZeroExtend(value); when EL2 SP_EL2 = ZeroExtend(value); when EL3 SP_EL3 = ZeroExtend(value); return; // SP[] - non-assignment form // ========================== // Read stack pointer with implicit slice of 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits. bits(width) SP[] X[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64}; if PSTATE.SP == '0' then return SP_EL0<width-1:0>; if n != 31 then return _R[n]<width-1:0>; else case PSTATE.EL of when return EL0Zeros return SP_EL0<width-1:0>; when EL1 return SP_EL1<width-1:0>; when EL2 return SP_EL2<width-1:0>; when EL3 return SP_EL3<width-1:0>;(width);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registerssve/VAArch32.IsFPEnabled

// V[] - assignment form // AArch32.IsFPEnabled() // ===================== // Write to SIMD&FP register with implicit extension from // 8, 16, 32, 64 or 128 bits. boolean V[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64,128}; integer vlen = ifAArch32.IsFPEnabled(bits(2) el) if el == IsSVEEnabledEL0(PSTATE.EL) then&& ! VLELUsingAArch32 else 128; if( ConstrainUnpredictableBoolEL1() then returnUnpredictable_SVEZEROUPPERAArch64.IsFPEnabled) then _Z[n] =(el); if ZeroExtendHaveEL(value); else _Z[n]<vlen-1:0> =( ZeroExtendEL3(value); // V[] - non-assignment form // ========================= // Read from SIMD&FP register with implicit slice of 8, 16 // 32, 64 or 128 bits. bits(width)) && (EL3) && !IsSecure() then // Check if access disabled in NSACR if NSACR.cp10 == '0' then return FALSE; if el IN {EL0, EL1} then // Check if access disabled in CPACR case CPACR.cp10 of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = (el == EL0); when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; if el IN {EL0, EL1, EL2} then if EL2Enabled() then if !ELUsingAArch32(EL2) then if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; else if HCPTR.TCP10 == '1' then return FALSE; if HaveEL(EL3) && !ELUsingAArch32(EL3V[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64,128}; return _Z[n]<width-1:0>;) then // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; return TRUE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registerssve/VpartAArch64.IsFPEnabled

// Vpart[] - non-assignment form // ============================= // Reads a 128-bit SIMD&FP register in up to two parts: // part 0 returns the bottom 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits of a value held in the register; // part 1 returns the top half of the bottom 64 bits or the top half of the 128-bit // value held in the register. // AArch64.IsFPEnabled() // ===================== bits(width)boolean Vpart[integer n, integer part] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert part IN {0, 1}; if part == 0 then assert width < 128; returnAArch64.IsFPEnabled(bits(2) el) // Check if access disabled in CPACR_EL1 if el IN { VEL0[n]; else assert width IN {32,64}; bits(128) vreg =, VEL1[n]; return vreg<(width * 2)-1:width>; // Vpart[] - assignment form // ========================= // Writes a 128-bit SIMD&FP register in up to two parts: // part 0 zero extends a 8, 16, 32, or 64-bit value to fill the whole register; // part 1 inserts a 64-bit value into the top half of the register.} then // Check FP&SIMD at EL0/EL1 case Vpart[integer n, integer part] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert part IN {0, 1}; if part == 0 then assert width < 128;[].FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = (el == VEL0[n] = value; else assert width == 64; bits(64) vreg =); when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL2 if el IN { VEL0[n];, , EL2} && EL2Enabled() then if HaveVirtHostExt() && HCR_EL2.E2H == '1' then if CPTR_EL2.FPEN == 'x0' then return FALSE; else if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if HaveEL(EL3VEL1[n] = value<63:0> : vreg;) then if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; return TRUE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/registerssve/XCeilPow2

// X[] - assignment form // ===================== // Write to general-purpose register from either a 32-bit or a 64-bit value.// CeilPow2() // ========== // For a positive integer X, return the smallest power of 2 >= X integer X[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {32,64}; if n != 31 then _R[n] =CeilPow2(integer x) if x == 0 then return 0; if x == 1 then return 2; return ZeroExtendFloorPow2(value); return; // X[] - non-assignment form // ========================= // Read from general-purpose register with implicit slice of 8, 16, 32 or 64 bits. bits(width) X[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width IN {8,16,32,64}; if n != 31 then return _R[n]<width-1:0>; else return Zeros(width);(x - 1) * 2;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/AArch32.IsFPEnabledCheckSVEEnabled

// AArch32.IsFPEnabled() // ===================== // Returns TRUE if access to the SIMD&FP instructions or System registers are // enabled at the target exception level in AArch32 state and FALSE otherwise. boolean// CheckSVEEnabled() // ================= AArch32.IsFPEnabled(bits(2) el) if el ==CheckSVEEnabled() // Check if access disabled in CPACR_EL1 if PSTATE.EL IN { EL0 && !,ELUsingAArch32(EL1) then return} && HCR_EL2.<E2H, TGE> != '11' then // Check SVE at EL0/EL1 case AArch64.IsFPEnabledCPACR(el); if[].ZEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL == HaveELEL0(; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled thenEL3SVEAccessTrap) &&( ELUsingAArch32EL1(); // Check FP&SIMD at EL0/EL1 caseEL3CPACR) && ![].FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL ==IsSecureEL0() then // Check if access disabled in NSACR if NSACR.cp10 == '0' then return FALSE; if el IN {; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled thenAArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL1); if PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1} then // Check if access disabled in CPACR case CPACR.cp10 of when '00' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = el ==, EL2} && EL2Enabled() then if HaveVirtHostExt() && HCR_EL2.E2H == '1' then if CPTR_EL2.ZEN == 'x0' || (PSTATE.EL == EL0; when '10' disabled =&& HCR_EL2.TGE == '1' && CPTR_EL2.ZEN == '01') then ConstrainUnpredictableBoolSVEAccessTrap(Unpredictable_RESCPACREL2); when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; if el IN { if CPTR_EL2.FPEN == 'x0' || (PSTATE.EL ==EL0,&& HCR_EL2.TGE == '1' && CPTR_EL2.FPEN == '01') then EL1AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap,( EL2} then if); else if CPTR_EL2.TZ == '1' then EL2EnabledSVEAccessTrap() then if !(ELUsingAArch32EL2(); if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' thenAArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL2) then if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; else if HCPTR.TCP10 == '1' then return FALSE; ); // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if HaveEL(EL3) && !) then if CPTR_EL3.EZ == '0' then(EL3); if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrapELUsingAArch32SVEAccessTrap(EL3) then // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; return TRUE;);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/AArch64.IsFPEnabledDecodePredCount

// AArch64.IsFPEnabled() // ===================== // Returns TRUE if access to the SIMD&FP instructions or System registers are // enabled at the target exception level in AArch64 state and FALSE otherwise. // DecodePredCount() // ================= booleaninteger AArch64.IsFPEnabled(bits(2) el) // Check if access disabled in CPACR_EL1 if el IN {DecodePredCount(bits(5) pattern, integer esize) integer elements =EL0VL,DIV esize; integer numElem; case pattern of when '00000' numElem = EL1FloorPow2} && !IsInHost() then // Check FP&SIMD at EL0/EL1 case CPACR_EL1.FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = el == EL0; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL2 if el IN {EL0, EL1, EL2} && EL2Enabled() then if HaveVirtHostExt() && HCR_EL2.E2H == '1' then case CPTR_EL2.FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = el == EL0 && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; else if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if HaveEL(EL3) then if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then return FALSE; return TRUE;(elements); when '00001' numElem = if elements >= 1 then 1 else 0; when '00010' numElem = if elements >= 2 then 2 else 0; when '00011' numElem = if elements >= 3 then 3 else 0; when '00100' numElem = if elements >= 4 then 4 else 0; when '00101' numElem = if elements >= 5 then 5 else 0; when '00110' numElem = if elements >= 6 then 6 else 0; when '00111' numElem = if elements >= 7 then 7 else 0; when '01000' numElem = if elements >= 8 then 8 else 0; when '01001' numElem = if elements >= 16 then 16 else 0; when '01010' numElem = if elements >= 32 then 32 else 0; when '01011' numElem = if elements >= 64 then 64 else 0; when '01100' numElem = if elements >= 128 then 128 else 0; when '01101' numElem = if elements >= 256 then 256 else 0; when '11101' numElem = elements - (elements MOD 4); when '11110' numElem = elements - (elements MOD 3); when '11111' numElem = elements; otherwise numElem = 0; return numElem;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/CeilPow2ElemFFR

// CeilPow2() // ========== // ElemFFR[] - non-assignment form // =============================== // For a positive integer X, return the smallest power of 2 >= X integerbit CeilPow2(integer x) if x == 0 then return 0; if x == 1 then return 2; ElemFFR[integer e, integer esize] return [_FFR, e, esize]; // ElemFFR[] - assignment form // =========================== ElemFFR[integer e, integer esize] = bit value integer psize = esize DIV 8; integer n = e * psize; assert n >= 0 && (n + psize) <= PL; _FFR<n+psize-1:n> = ZeroExtendFloorPow2ElemP(x - 1) * 2;(value, psize); return;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/CheckSVEEnabledElemP

// CheckSVEEnabled() // ================= // Checks for traps on SVE instructions and instructions that // access SVE System registers.// ElemP[] - non-assignment form // ============================= bit CheckSVEEnabled() // Check if access disabled in CPACR_EL1 if PSTATE.EL IN {ElemP[bits(N) pred, integer e, integer esize] integer n = e * (esize DIV 8); assert n >= 0 && n < N; return pred<n>; // ElemP[] - assignment form // =========================EL0,ElemP[bits(N) &pred, integer e, integer esize] = bit value integer psize = esize DIV 8; integer n = e * psize; assert n >= 0 && (n + psize) <= N; pred<n+psize-1:n> = EL1ZeroExtend} && !IsInHost() then // Check SVE at EL0/EL1 case CPACR_EL1.ZEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL == EL0; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then SVEAccessTrap(EL1); // Check SIMD&FP at EL0/EL1 case CPACR_EL1.FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL == EL0; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL1); // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL2 if PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1, EL2} && EL2Enabled() then if HaveVirtHostExt() && HCR_EL2.E2H == '1' then // Check SVE at EL2 case CPTR_EL2.ZEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL == EL0 && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then SVEAccessTrap(EL2); // Check SIMD&FP at EL2 case CPTR_EL2.FPEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = PSTATE.EL == EL0 && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL2); else if CPTR_EL2.TZ == '1' then SVEAccessTrap(EL2); if CPTR_EL2.TFP == '1' then AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL2); // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if HaveEL(EL3) then if CPTR_EL3.EZ == '0' then SVEAccessTrap(EL3); if CPTR_EL3.TFP == '1' then AArch64.AdvSIMDFPAccessTrap(EL3);(value, psize); return;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/DecodePredCountFFR

// DecodePredCount() // ================= // FFR[] - non-assignment form // =========================== integerbits(width) DecodePredCount(bits(5) pattern, integer esize) integer elements =FFR[] assert width == VLPL DIV esize; integer numElem; case pattern of when '00000' numElem =; return _FFR<width-1:0>; // FFR[] - assignment form // ======================= FFR[] = bits(width) value assert width == PL; if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _FFR = ZeroExtendFloorPow2(elements); when '00001' numElem = if elements >= 1 then 1 else 0; when '00010' numElem = if elements >= 2 then 2 else 0; when '00011' numElem = if elements >= 3 then 3 else 0; when '00100' numElem = if elements >= 4 then 4 else 0; when '00101' numElem = if elements >= 5 then 5 else 0; when '00110' numElem = if elements >= 6 then 6 else 0; when '00111' numElem = if elements >= 7 then 7 else 0; when '01000' numElem = if elements >= 8 then 8 else 0; when '01001' numElem = if elements >= 16 then 16 else 0; when '01010' numElem = if elements >= 32 then 32 else 0; when '01011' numElem = if elements >= 64 then 64 else 0; when '01100' numElem = if elements >= 128 then 128 else 0; when '01101' numElem = if elements >= 256 then 256 else 0; when '11101' numElem = elements - (elements MOD 4); when '11110' numElem = elements - (elements MOD 3); when '11111' numElem = elements; otherwise numElem = 0; return numElem;(value); else _FFR<width-1:0> = value;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/ElemFFRFPCompareNE

// ElemFFR[] - non-assignment form // =============================== // FPCompareNE() // ============= bitboolean ElemFFR[integer e, integer esize] returnFPCompareNE(bits(N) op1, bits(N) op2, ElemPFPCRType[_FFR, e, esize]; // ElemFFR[] - assignment form // ===========================fpcr) assert N IN {16,32,64}; (type1,sign1,value1) = ElemFFR[integer e, integer esize] = bit value integer psize = esize DIV 8; integer n = e * psize; assert n >= 0 && (n + psize) <=(op1, fpcr); (type2,sign2,value2) = PLFPUnpack; _FFR<n+psize-1:n> =(op2, fpcr); if type1== || type1==FPType_QNaN || type2==FPType_SNaN || type2==FPType_QNaN then result = TRUE; if type1==FPType_SNaN || type2==FPType_SNaN then FPProcessException(FPExc_InvalidOpZeroExtendFPType_SNaN(value, psize); return;, fpcr); else // All non-NaN cases can be evaluated on the values produced by FPUnpack() result = (value1 != value2); return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/ElemPFPCompareUN

// ElemP[] - non-assignment form // ============================= // FPCompareUN() // ============= bitboolean ElemP[bits(N) pred, integer e, integer esize] integer n = e * (esize DIV 8); assert n >= 0 && n < N; return pred<n>; // ElemP[] - assignment form // =========================FPCompareUN(bits(N) op1, bits(N) op2, ElemP[bits(N) &pred, integer e, integer esize] = bit value integer psize = esize DIV 8; integer n = e * psize; assert n >= 0 && (n + psize) <= N; pred<n+psize-1:n> =fpcr) assert N IN {16,32,64}; (type1,sign1,value1) = (op1, fpcr); (type2,sign2,value2) = FPUnpack(op2, fpcr); if type1==FPType_SNaN || type2==FPType_SNaN then FPProcessException(FPExc_InvalidOp, fpcr); return (type1==FPType_SNaN || type1==FPType_QNaN || type2==FPType_SNaN || type2==FPType_QNaNZeroExtendFPUnpack(value, psize); return;);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FFRFPConvertSVE

// FFR[] - non-assignment form // =========================== // FPConvertSVE() // ============== bits(width)bits(M) FFR[] assert width ==FPConvertSVE(bits(N) op, PLFPCRType; return _FFR<width-1:0>; // FFR[] - assignment form // =======================fpcr, FPRounding rounding) fpcr.AHP = '0'; return FPConvert(op, fpcr, rounding); // FPConvertSVE() // ============== bits(M) FFR[] = bits(width) value assert width ==FPConvertSVE(bits(N) op, PLFPCRType; iffpcr) fpcr.AHP = '0'; return ConstrainUnpredictableBoolFPConvert((op, fpcr,Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPERFPRoundingMode) then _FFR = ZeroExtend(value); else _FFR<width-1:0> = value;(fpcr));

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FPCompareNEFPExpA

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FPScaleFPTrigSMul

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FPTrigMAddFPTrigSSel

// FPTrigMAdd() // FPTrigSSel() // ============ bits(N) FPTrigMAdd(integer x, bits(N) op1, bits(N) op2,FPTrigSSel(bits(N) op1, bits(N) op2) assert N IN {16,32,64}; bits(N) result; if op2<0> == '1' then result = FPCRTypeFPOne fpcr) assert N IN {16,32,64}; assert x >= 0; assert x < 8; bits(N) coeff; if op2<N-1> == '1' then x = x + 8; op2<N-1> = '0'; coeff = FPTrigMAddCoefficient[x]; result = FPMulAdd(coeff, op1, op2, fpcr); (op2<1>); else result = op1; result<N-1> = result<N-1> EOR op2<1>; return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FPTrigMAddCoefficientFirstActive

// FPTrigMAddCoefficient() // ======================= // FirstActive() // ============= bits(N)bit FPTrigMAddCoefficient[integer index] assert N IN {16,32,64}; integer result; if N == 16 then case index of when 0 result = 0x3c00; when 1 result = 0xb155; when 2 result = 0x2030; when 3 result = 0x0000; when 4 result = 0x0000; when 5 result = 0x0000; when 6 result = 0x0000; when 7 result = 0x0000; when 8 result = 0x3c00; when 9 result = 0xb800; when 10 result = 0x293a; when 11 result = 0x0000; when 12 result = 0x0000; when 13 result = 0x0000; when 14 result = 0x0000; when 15 result = 0x0000; elsif N == 32 then case index of when 0 result = 0x3f800000; when 1 result = 0xbe2aaaab; when 2 result = 0x3c088886; when 3 result = 0xb95008b9; when 4 result = 0x36369d6d; when 5 result = 0x00000000; when 6 result = 0x00000000; when 7 result = 0x00000000; when 8 result = 0x3f800000; when 9 result = 0xbf000000; when 10 result = 0x3d2aaaa6; when 11 result = 0xbab60705; when 12 result = 0x37cd37cc; when 13 result = 0x00000000; when 14 result = 0x00000000; when 15 result = 0x00000000; else // N == 64 case index of when 0 result = 0x3ff0000000000000; when 1 result = 0xbfc5555555555543; when 2 result = 0x3f8111111110f30c; when 3 result = 0xbf2a01a019b92fc6; when 4 result = 0x3ec71de351f3d22b; when 5 result = 0xbe5ae5e2b60f7b91; when 6 result = 0x3de5d8408868552f; when 7 result = 0x0000000000000000; when 8 result = 0x3ff0000000000000; when 9 result = 0xbfe0000000000000; when 10 result = 0x3fa5555555555536; when 11 result = 0xbf56c16c16c13a0b; when 12 result = 0x3efa01a019b1e8d8; when 13 result = 0xbe927e4f7282f468; when 14 result = 0x3e21ee96d2641b13; when 15 result = 0xbda8f76380fbb401; return result<N-1:0>;FirstActive(bits(N) mask, bits(N) x, integer esize) integer elements = N DIV (esize DIV 8); for e = 0 to elements-1 ifElemP[mask, e, esize] == '1' then return ElemP[x, e, esize]; return '0';

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/FPTrigSMulFloorPow2

// FPTrigSMul() // ============ // FloorPow2() // =========== // For a positive integer X, return the largest power of 2 <= X bits(N)integer FPTrigSMul(bits(N) op1, bits(N) op2,FloorPow2(integer x) assert x >= 0; integer n = 1; if x == 0 then return 0; while x >= 2^n do n = n + 1; return 2^(n - 1); FPCRType fpcr) assert N IN {16,32,64}; result = FPMul(op1, op1, fpcr); (fptype, sign, value) = FPUnpack(result, fpcr); if (fptype != FPType_QNaN) && (fptype != FPType_SNaN) then result<N-1> = op2<0>; return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/ImplementedSVEVectorLengthIsSVEEnabled

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/IsSVEEnabledMAX_PL

// IsSVEEnabled() // ============== // Returns TRUE if access to SVE instructions and System registers is // enabled at the target exception level and FALSE otherwise. booleanconstant integer IsSVEEnabled(bits(2) el) ifMAX_PL = 256; ELUsingAArch32(el) then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPACR_EL1 if el IN {EL0, EL1} && !IsInHost() then // Check SVE at EL0/EL1 case CPACR_EL1.ZEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = el == EL0; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL2 if el IN {EL0, EL1, EL2} && EL2Enabled() then if HaveVirtHostExt() && HCR_EL2.E2H == '1' then case CPTR_EL2.ZEN of when 'x0' disabled = TRUE; when '01' disabled = el == EL0 && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; when '11' disabled = FALSE; if disabled then return FALSE; else if CPTR_EL2.TZ == '1' then return FALSE; // Check if access disabled in CPTR_EL3 if HaveEL(EL3) then if CPTR_EL3.EZ == '0' then return FALSE; return TRUE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/LastActiveMAX_VL

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/LastActiveElementMaybeZeroSVEUppers

// LastActiveElement() // =================== integer// MaybeZeroSVEUppers() // ==================== LastActiveElement(bits(N) mask, integer esize) assert esize IN {8, 16, 32, 64}; integer elements =MaybeZeroSVEUppers(bits(2) target_el) boolean lower_enabled; if UInt(target_el) <= UInt(PSTATE.EL) || !IsSVEEnabled(target_el) then return; if target_el == EL3 then if EL2Enabled() then lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(EL2); else lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(EL1); else lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(target_el - 1); if lower_enabled then integer vl = if IsSVEEnabled(PSTATE.EL) then VL DIV esize; for e = elements-1 downto 0 ifelse 128; integer pl = vl DIV 8; for n = 0 to 31 if (Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _Z[n] = ZeroExtend(_Z[n]<vl-1:0>); for n = 0 to 15 if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _P[n] = ZeroExtend(_P[n]<pl-1:0>); if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _FFR = ZeroExtendElemPConstrainUnpredictableBool[mask, e, esize] == '1' then return e; return -1;(_FFR<pl-1:0>);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/MAX_PLMemNF

constant integer// MemNF[] - non-assignment form // ============================= (bits(8*size), boolean) MemNF[bits(64) address, integer size, acctype] assert size IN {1, 2, 4, 8, 16}; bits(8*size) value; aligned = (address == Align(address, size)); A = SCTLR[].A; if !aligned && (A == '1') then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); atomic = aligned || size == 1; if !atomic then (value<7:0>, bad) = MemSingleNF[address, 1, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // For subsequent bytes it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether an unaligned Device memory // access will generate an Alignment Fault, as to get this far means the first byte did // not, so we must be changing to a new translation page. if !aligned then c = ConstrainUnpredictable(Unpredictable_DEVPAGE2); assert c IN {Constraint_FAULT, Constraint_NONE}; if c == Constraint_NONE then aligned = TRUE; for i = 1 to size-1 (value<8*i+7:8*i>, bad) = MemSingleNF[address+i, 1, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); else (value, bad) = MemSingleNF[address, size, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); if BigEndian() then value = BigEndianReverseMAX_PL = 256;(value); return (value, FALSE);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/MAX_VLMemSingleNF

constant integer// MemSingleNF[] - non-assignment form // =================================== (bits(8*size), boolean) MemSingleNF[bits(64) address, integer size, acctype, boolean wasaligned] bits(8*size) value; boolean iswrite = FALSE; AddressDescriptor memaddrdesc; // Implementation may suppress NF load for any reason if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_NONFAULT) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // MMU or MPU memaddrdesc = AArch64.TranslateAddress(address, acctype, iswrite, wasaligned, size); // Non-fault load from Device memory must not be performed externally if memaddrdesc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // Check for aborts or debug exceptions if IsFault(memaddrdesc) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // Memory array access accdesc = CreateAccessDescriptor(acctype); if HaveMTEExt() then if AArch64.AccessIsTagChecked(address, acctype) then bits(4) ptag = AArch64.PhysicalTag(address); if !AArch64.CheckTagMAX_VL = 2048;(memaddrdesc, ptag, iswrite) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); value = _Mem[memaddrdesc, size, accdesc]; return (value, FALSE);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/MaybeZeroSVEUppersNoneActive

// MaybeZeroSVEUppers() // ====================// NoneActive() // ============ bit MaybeZeroSVEUppers(bits(2) target_el) boolean lower_enabled; ifNoneActive(bits(N) mask, bits(N) x, integer esize) integer elements = N DIV (esize DIV 8); for e = 0 to elements-1 if UIntElemP(target_el) <=[mask, e, esize] == '1' && UIntElemP(PSTATE.EL) || !IsSVEEnabled(target_el) then return; if target_el == EL3 then if EL2Enabled() then lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(EL2); else lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(EL1); else lower_enabled = IsFPEnabled(target_el - 1); if lower_enabled then integer vl = if IsSVEEnabled(PSTATE.EL) then VL else 128; integer pl = vl DIV 8; for n = 0 to 31 if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _Z[n] = ZeroExtend(_Z[n]<vl-1:0>); for n = 0 to 15 if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _P[n] = ZeroExtend(_P[n]<pl-1:0>); if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER) then _FFR = ZeroExtend(_FFR<pl-1:0>);[x, e, esize] == '1' then return '0'; return '1';

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/MemNFP

// MemNF[] - non-assignment form // ============================= // P[] - non-assignment form // ========================= (bits(8*size), boolean) MemNF[bits(64) address, integer size,bits(width) AccType acctype] assert size IN {1, 2, 4, 8, 16}; bits(8*size) value; aligned = (address ==P[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width == AlignPL(address, size)); A =; return _P[n]<width-1:0>; // P[] - assignment form // ===================== SCTLR[].A; if !aligned && (A == '1') then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); atomic = aligned || size == 1; if !atomic then (value<7:0>, bad) = MemSingleNF[address, 1, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // For subsequent bytes it is CONSTRAINED UNPREDICTABLE whether an unaligned Device memory // access will generate an Alignment Fault, as to get this far means the first byte did // not, so we must be changing to a new translation page. if !aligned then c =P[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width == ConstrainUnpredictablePL(; ifUnpredictable_DEVPAGE2ConstrainUnpredictableBool); assert c IN {(Constraint_FAULTUnpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER,) then _P[n] = Constraint_NONEZeroExtend}; if c == Constraint_NONE then aligned = TRUE; for i = 1 to size-1 (value<8*i+7:8*i>, bad) = MemSingleNF[address+i, 1, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); else (value, bad) = MemSingleNF[address, size, acctype, aligned]; if bad then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); if BigEndian() then value = BigEndianReverse(value); return (value, FALSE); else _P[n]<width-1:0> = value;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/MemSingleNFPL

// MemSingleNF[] - non-assignment form // =================================== // PL - non-assignment form // ======================== (bits(8*size), boolean) MemSingleNF[bits(64) address, integer size,integer AccType acctype, boolean wasaligned] bits(8*size) value; boolean iswrite = FALSE;PL return AddressDescriptorVL memaddrdesc; // Implementation may suppress NF load for any reason if ConstrainUnpredictableBool(Unpredictable_NONFAULT) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // MMU or MPU memaddrdesc = AArch64.TranslateAddress(address, acctype, iswrite, wasaligned, size); // Non-fault load from Device memory must not be performed externally if memaddrdesc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // Check for aborts or debug exceptions if IsFault(memaddrdesc) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); // Memory array access accdesc = CreateAccessDescriptor(acctype); if HaveMTEExt() then if AArch64.AccessIsTagChecked(address, acctype) then bits(4) ptag = AArch64.PhysicalTag(address); if !AArch64.CheckTag(memaddrdesc, ptag, iswrite) then return (bits(8*size) UNKNOWN, TRUE); value = _Mem[memaddrdesc, size, accdesc]; return (value, FALSE);DIV 8;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/NoneActivePredTest

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/PReducePredicated

// P[] - non-assignment form // ========================= // ReducePredicated() // ================== bits(width)bits(esize) P[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width ==ReducePredicated( PLReduceOp; return _P[n]<width-1:0>; // P[] - assignment form // =====================op, bits(N) input, bits(M) mask, bits(esize) identity) assert(N == M * 8); integer p2bits = P[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width ==(N); bits(p2bits) operand; integer elements = p2bits DIV esize; for e = 0 to elements-1 if e * esize < N && PLElemP; if[mask, e, esize] == '1' then ConstrainUnpredictableBoolElem([operand, e, esize] =Unpredictable_SVEZEROUPPERElem) then _P[n] =[input, e, esize]; else [operand, e, esize] = identity; return ReduceZeroExtendElem(value); else _P[n]<width-1:0> = value;(op, operand, esize);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/PLReverse

// PL - non-assignment form // ======================== // Reverse() // ========= // Reverse subwords of M bits in an N-bit word integerbits(N) PL returnReverse(bits(N) word, integer M) bits(N) result; integer sw = N DIV M; assert N == sw * M; for s = 0 to sw-1 [result, sw - 1 - s, M] = ElemVLElem DIV 8;[word, s, M]; return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/PredTestSVEAccessTrap

// PredTest() // ========== bits(4)// SVEAccessTrap() // =============== // Trapped access to SVE registers due to CPACR_EL1, CPTR_EL2, or CPTR_EL3. PredTest(bits(N) mask, bits(N) result, integer esize) bit n =SVEAccessTrap(bits(2) target_el) assert FirstActiveUInt(mask, result, esize); bit z =(target_el) >= NoneActiveUInt(mask, result, esize); bit c = NOT(PSTATE.EL) && target_el != && HaveEL(target_el); route_to_el2 = target_el == EL1 && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; exception = ExceptionSyndrome(Exception_SVEAccessTrap); bits(64) preferred_exception_return = ThisInstrAddr(); vect_offset = 0x0; if route_to_el2 then AArch64.TakeException(EL2, exception, preferred_exception_return, vect_offset); else AArch64.TakeExceptionLastActiveEL0(mask, result, esize); bit v = '0'; return n:z:c:v;(target_el, exception, preferred_exception_return, vect_offset);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/ReducePredicatedSVECmp

// ReducePredicated() // ================== bits(esize)enumeration ReducePredicated(SVECmp {ReduceOp op, bits(N) input, bits(M) mask, bits(esize) identity) assert(N == M * 8); integer p2bits =Cmp_EQ, CeilPow2(N); bits(p2bits) operand; integer elements = p2bits DIV esize; for e = 0 to elements-1 if e * esize < N &&Cmp_NE, ElemP[mask, e, esize] == '1' thenCmp_GE, Elem[operand, e, esize] =Cmp_GT, Elem[input, e, esize]; elseCmp_LT, Elem[operand, e, esize] = identity; returnCmp_LE, Reduce(op, operand, esize);Cmp_UN };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/ReverseSVEMoveMaskPreferred

// Reverse() // ========= // Reverse subwords of M bits in an N-bit word // SVEMoveMaskPreferred() // ====================== // Return FALSE if a bitmask immediate encoding would generate an immediate // value that could also be represented by a single DUP instruction. // Used as a condition for the preferred MOV<-DUPM alias. bits(N)boolean Reverse(bits(N) word, integer M) bits(N) result; integer sw = N DIV M; assert N == sw * M; for s = 0 to sw-1SVEMoveMaskPreferred(bits(13) imm13) bits(64) imm; (imm, -) = ElemDecodeBitMasks[result, sw - 1 - s, M] =(imm13<12>, imm13<5:0>, imm13<11:6>, TRUE); // Check for 8 bit immediates if ! (imm<7:0>) then // Check for 'ffffffffffffffxy' or '00000000000000xy' if IsZero(imm<63:7>) || IsOnes(imm<63:7>) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffffffxyffffffxy' or '000000xy000000xy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && (IsZero(imm<31:7>) || IsOnes(imm<31:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffxyffxyffxyffxy' or '00xy00xy00xy00xy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> && (IsZero(imm<15:7>) || IsOnes(imm<15:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'xyxyxyxyxyxyxyxy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> && (imm<15:8> == imm<7:0>) then return FALSE; // Check for 16 bit immediates else // Check for 'ffffffffffffxy00' or '000000000000xy00' if IsZero(imm<63:15>) || IsOnes(imm<63:15>) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffffxy00ffffxy00' or '0000xy000000xy00' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && (IsZero(imm<31:7>) || IsOnesElemIsZero[word, s, M]; return result;(imm<31:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'xy00xy00xy00xy00' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> then return FALSE; return TRUE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/SVEAccessTrapSystem

// SVEAccessTrap() // =============== // Trapped access to SVE registers due to CPACR_EL1, CPTR_EL2, or CPTR_EL3.array bits( SVEAccessTrap(bits(2) target_el) assert) _Z[0..31]; array bits( UIntMAX_PL(target_el) >=) _P[0..15]; bits( UIntMAX_PL(PSTATE.EL) && target_el != EL0 && HaveEL(target_el); route_to_el2 = target_el == EL1 && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.TGE == '1'; exception = ExceptionSyndrome(Exception_SVEAccessTrap); bits(64) preferred_exception_return = ThisInstrAddr(); vect_offset = 0x0; if route_to_el2 then AArch64.TakeException(EL2, exception, preferred_exception_return, vect_offset); else AArch64.TakeException(target_el, exception, preferred_exception_return, vect_offset);) _FFR;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/SVECmpVL

enumeration// VL - non-assignment form // ======================== integer SVECmp {VL integer vl; if PSTATE.EL == Cmp_EQ,|| (PSTATE.EL == Cmp_NE,&& ! Cmp_GE,()) then vl = Cmp_GT,(ZCR_EL1.LEN); if PSTATE.EL == Cmp_LT,|| (PSTATE.EL == Cmp_LE,&& ()) then vl = UInt(ZCR_EL2.LEN); elsif PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1} && EL2Enabled() then vl = Min(vl, UInt(ZCR_EL2.LEN)); if PSTATE.EL == EL3 then vl = UInt(ZCR_EL3.LEN); elsif HaveEL(EL3) then vl = Min(vl, UInt(ZCR_EL3.LEN)); vl = (vl + 1) * 128; vl = ImplementedSVEVectorLengthCmp_UN };(vl); return vl;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sve/SVEMoveMaskPreferredZ

// SVEMoveMaskPreferred() // ====================== // Return FALSE if a bitmask immediate encoding would generate an immediate // value that could also be represented by a single DUP instruction. // Used as a condition for the preferred MOV<-DUPM alias. // Z[] - non-assignment form // ========================= booleanbits(width) SVEMoveMaskPreferred(bits(13) imm13) bits(64) imm; (imm, -) =Z[integer n] assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width == DecodeBitMasksVL(imm13<12>, imm13<5:0>, imm13<11:6>, TRUE); ; return _Z[n]<width-1:0>; // Check for 8 bit immediates if !// Z[] - assignment form // =====================IsZero(imm<7:0>) then // Check for 'ffffffffffffffxy' or '00000000000000xy' ifZ[integer n] = bits(width) value assert n >= 0 && n <= 31; assert width == IsZeroVL(imm<63:7>) ||; if IsOnesConstrainUnpredictableBool(imm<63:7>) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffffffxyffffffxy' or '000000xy000000xy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && ((IsZeroUnpredictable_SVEZEROUPPER(imm<31:7>) ||) then _Z[n] = IsOnesZeroExtend(imm<31:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffxyffxyffxyffxy' or '00xy00xy00xy00xy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> && (IsZero(imm<15:7>) || IsOnes(imm<15:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'xyxyxyxyxyxyxyxy' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> && (imm<15:8> == imm<7:0>) then return FALSE; // Check for 16 bit immediates else // Check for 'ffffffffffffxy00' or '000000000000xy00' if IsZero(imm<63:15>) || IsOnes(imm<63:15>) then return FALSE; // Check for 'ffffxy00ffffxy00' or '0000xy000000xy00' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && (IsZero(imm<31:7>) || IsOnes(imm<31:7>)) then return FALSE; // Check for 'xy00xy00xy00xy00' if imm<63:32> == imm<31:0> && imm<31:16> == imm<15:0> then return FALSE; return TRUE;(value); else _Z[n]<width-1:0> = value;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/svesysregisters/SystemCNTKCTL

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/svesysregisters/VLCNTKCTLType

// VL - non-assignment form // ======================== integertype VL integer vl; if PSTATE.EL ==CNTKCTLType; EL1 || (PSTATE.EL == EL0 && !IsInHost()) then vl = UInt(ZCR_EL1.LEN); if PSTATE.EL == EL2 || (PSTATE.EL == EL0 && IsInHost()) then vl = UInt(ZCR_EL2.LEN); elsif PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1} && EL2Enabled() then vl = Min(vl, UInt(ZCR_EL2.LEN)); if PSTATE.EL == EL3 then vl = UInt(ZCR_EL3.LEN); elsif HaveEL(EL3) then vl = Min(vl, UInt(ZCR_EL3.LEN)); vl = (vl + 1) * 128; vl = ImplementedSVEVectorLength(vl); return vl;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sysregisterssystem/SCTLRAArch64.AllocationTagAccessIsEnabled

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sysregisterssystem/SCTLRTypeAArch64.CheckSystemAccess

type// AArch64.CheckSystemAccess() // =========================== // Checks if an AArch64 MSR, MRS or SYS instruction is allowed from the current exception level and security state. // Also checks for traps by TIDCP and NV access. SCTLRType;AArch64.CheckSystemAccess(bits(2) op0, bits(3) op1, bits(4) crn, bits(4) crm, bits(3) op2, bits(5) rt, bit read) boolean unallocated = FALSE; boolean need_secure = FALSE; bits(2) min_EL; // Check for traps by HCR_EL2.TIDCP if PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1} && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.TIDCP == '1' && op0 == 'x1' && crn == '1x11' then // At EL0, it is IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED whether attempts to execute system // register access instructions with reserved encodings are trapped to EL2 or UNDEFINED rcs_el0_trap = boolean IMPLEMENTATION_DEFINED "Reserved Control Space EL0 Trapped"; if PSTATE.EL == EL1 || rcs_el0_trap then AArch64.SystemAccessTrap(EL2, 0x18); // Exception_SystemRegisterTrap // Check for unallocated encodings case op1 of when '00x', '010' min_EL = EL1; when '011' min_EL = EL0; when '100' min_EL = EL2; when '101' if !HaveVirtHostExt() then UNDEFINED; min_EL = EL2; when '110' min_EL = EL3; when '111' min_EL = EL1; need_secure = TRUE; if UInt(PSTATE.EL) < UInt(min_EL) then // Check for traps on read/write access to registers named _EL2, _EL02, _EL12 from EL1 when // EL2 is enabled in the current security state, and the HCR_EL2.NV bit is set nv_access = HaveNVExt() && min_EL == EL2 && PSTATE.EL == EL1 && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.NV == '1'; if !nv_access then UNDEFINED; elsif need_secure && !IsSecure() then UNDEFINED;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/sysregisterssystem/VBARAArch64.ChooseNonExcludedTag

// VBAR[] - non-assignment form // ============================ // AArch64.ChooseNonExcludedTag() // ============================== // Return a tag derived from the start and the offset values, excluding // any tags in the given mask. bits(64)bits(4) VBAR[bits(2) regime] bits(64) r; case regime of whenAArch64.ChooseNonExcludedTag(bits(4) tag, bits(4) offset, bits(16) exclude) if EL1IsOnes r = VBAR_EL1; when(exclude) then return '0000'; if offset == '0000' then while exclude< EL2UInt r = VBAR_EL2; when(tag)> == '1' do tag = tag + '0001'; while offset != '0000' do offset = offset - '0001'; tag = tag + '0001'; while exclude< EL3UInt r = VBAR_EL3; otherwise Unreachable(); return r; // VBAR[] - non-assignment form // ============================ bits(64) VBAR[] return VBAR[S1TranslationRegime()];(tag)> == '1' do tag = tag + '0001'; return tag;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/system/AArch64.AllocationTagAccessIsEnabledAArch64.ExecutingATS1xPInstr

// AArch64.AllocationTagAccessIsEnabled() // ====================================== // Check whether access to Allocation Tags is enabled. // AArch64.ExecutingATS1xPInstr() // ============================== // Return TRUE if current instruction is AT S1E1R/WP boolean AArch64.AllocationTagAccessIsEnabled() if SCR_EL3.ATA == '0' && PSTATE.EL IN {AArch64.ExecutingATS1xPInstr() if !EL0HavePrivATExt,() then return FALSE; instr = EL1ThisInstr, EL2} then return FALSE; elsif HCR_EL2.ATA == '0' && PSTATE.EL IN {EL0, EL1} && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.<E2H,TGE> != '11' then return FALSE; elsif SCTLR_EL3.ATA == '0' && PSTATE.EL == EL3 then return FALSE; elsif SCTLR_EL2.ATA == '0' && PSTATE.EL == EL2 then return FALSE; elsif SCTLR_EL1.ATA == '0' && PSTATE.EL == EL1 then return FALSE; elsif SCTLR_EL2.ATA0 == '0' && PSTATE.EL == EL0 && EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.<E2H,TGE> == '11' then return FALSE; elsif SCTLR_EL1.ATA0 == '0' && PSTATE.EL == EL0 && !(EL2Enabled() && HCR_EL2.<E2H,TGE> == '11') then return FALSE; (); if instr<22+:10> == '1101010100' then op1 = instr<16+:3>; CRn = instr<12+:4>; CRm = instr<8+:4>; op2 = instr<5+:3>; return op1 == '000' && CRn == '0111' && CRm == '1001' && op2 IN {'000','001'}; else return TRUE; return FALSE;

A value of TRUE here indicates a valid Branch Target Identification instruction. boolean// SetBTypeCompatible() // ==================== // Sets the value of BTypeCompatible global variable used by BTI BTypeCompatible_BTI(bits(2) hintcode) case hintcode of when '00' return FALSE; when '01' return PSTATE.BTYPE != '11'; when '10' return PSTATE.BTYPE != '10'; when '11' return TRUE;SetBTypeCompatible(boolean x) BTypeCompatible = x;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/system/BTypeCompatible_PACIXSPSetBTypeNext

// BTypeCompatible_PACIXSP() // ========================= // Returns TRUE if PACIASP, PACIBSP instruction is implicit compatible with PSTATE.BTYPE, // FALSE otherwise. boolean// SetBTypeNext() // ============== // Set the value of BTypeNext global variable used by BTI BTypeCompatible_PACIXSP() if PSTATE.BTYPE IN {'01', '10'} then return TRUE; elsif PSTATE.BTYPE == '11' then index = if PSTATE.EL ==SetBTypeNext(bits(2) x) BTypeNext = x; EL0 then 35 else 36; return SCTLR[]<index> == '0'; else return FALSE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functions/system/BTypeNext_ChooseRandomNonExcludedTag

bits(2) BTypeNext;// The _ChooseRandomNonExcludedTag function is used when GCR_EL1.RRND == '1' to generate random // Allocation Tags. // // The resulting Allocation Tag is selected from the set [0,15], excluding any Allocation Tag where // exclude[tag_value] == 1. If 'exclude' is all ones, the returned Allocation Tag is '0000'. // // This function is expected to generate a non-deterministic selection from the set of non-excluded // Allocation Tags. A reasonable implementation is described by the Pseudocode used when // GCR_EL1.RRND is 0, but with a non-deterministic implementation of NextRandomTagBit(). bits(4) _ChooseRandomNonExcludedTag(bits(16) exclude);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functionsinstrs/systembranch/InGuardedPageeret/AArch64.ExceptionReturn

boolean InGuardedPage;// AArch64.ExceptionReturn() // =========================AArch64.ExceptionReturn(bits(64) new_pc, bits(32) spsr) SynchronizeContext(); sync_errors = HaveIESB() && SCTLR[].IESB == '1'; if HaveDoubleFaultExt() then sync_errors = sync_errors || (SCR_EL3.EA == '1' && SCR_EL3.NMEA == '1' && PSTATE.EL == EL3); if sync_errors then SynchronizeErrors(); iesb_req = TRUE; TakeUnmaskedPhysicalSErrorInterrupts(iesb_req); // Attempts to change to an illegal state will invoke the Illegal Execution state mechanism SetPSTATEFromPSR(spsr); ClearExclusiveLocal(ProcessorID()); SendEventLocal(); if PSTATE.IL == '1' && spsr<4> == '1' && spsr<20> == '0' then // If the exception return is illegal, PC[63:32,1:0] are UNKNOWN new_pc<63:32> = bits(32) UNKNOWN; new_pc<1:0> = bits(2) UNKNOWN; elsif UsingAArch32() then // Return to AArch32 // ELR_ELx[1:0] or ELR_ELx[0] are treated as being 0, depending on the target instruction set state if PSTATE.T == '1' then new_pc<0> = '0'; // T32 else new_pc<1:0> = '00'; // A32 else // Return to AArch64 // ELR_ELx[63:56] might include a tag new_pc = AArch64.BranchAddr(new_pc); if UsingAArch32() then // 32 most significant bits are ignored. BranchTo(new_pc<31:0>, BranchType_ERET); else BranchToAddr(new_pc, BranchType_ERET);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functionsinstrs/systemcountop/SetBTypeCompatibleCountOp

// SetBTypeCompatible() // ==================== // Sets the value of BTypeCompatible global variable used by BTIenumeration SetBTypeCompatible(boolean x) BTypeCompatible = x;CountOp {CountOp_CLZ, CountOp_CLS, CountOp_CNT};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functionsinstrs/systemextendreg/SetBTypeNextDecodeRegExtend

// SetBTypeNext() // ============== // Set the value of BTypeNext global variable used by BTI// DecodeRegExtend() // ================= // Decode a register extension option ExtendType SetBTypeNext(bits(2) x) BTypeNext = x;DecodeRegExtend(bits(3) op) case op of when '000' returnExtendType_UXTB; when '001' return ExtendType_UXTH; when '010' return ExtendType_UXTW; when '011' return ExtendType_UXTX; when '100' return ExtendType_SXTB; when '101' return ExtendType_SXTH; when '110' return ExtendType_SXTW; when '111' return ExtendType_SXTX;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/functionsinstrs/systemextendreg/_ChooseRandomNonExcludedTagExtendReg

// The _ChooseRandomNonExcludedTag function is used when GCR_EL1.RRND == '1' to generate random // Allocation Tags. // // The resulting Allocation Tag is selected from the set [0,15], excluding any Allocation Tag where // exclude[tag_value] == 1. If 'exclude' is all ones, the returned Allocation Tag is '0000'. // // This function is expected to generate a non-deterministic selection from the set of non-excluded // Allocation Tags. A reasonable implementation is described by the Pseudocode used when // GCR_EL1.RRND is 0, but with a non-deterministic implementation of NextRandomTagBit(). bits(4) _ChooseRandomNonExcludedTag(bits(16) exclude);// ExtendReg() // =========== // Perform a register extension and shift bits(N)ExtendReg(integer reg, ExtendType exttype, integer shift) assert shift >= 0 && shift <= 4; bits(N) val = X[reg]; boolean unsigned; integer len; case exttype of when ExtendType_SXTB unsigned = FALSE; len = 8; when ExtendType_SXTH unsigned = FALSE; len = 16; when ExtendType_SXTW unsigned = FALSE; len = 32; when ExtendType_SXTX unsigned = FALSE; len = 64; when ExtendType_UXTB unsigned = TRUE; len = 8; when ExtendType_UXTH unsigned = TRUE; len = 16; when ExtendType_UXTW unsigned = TRUE; len = 32; when ExtendType_UXTX unsigned = TRUE; len = 64; // Note the extended width of the intermediate value and // that sign extension occurs from bit <len+shift-1>, not // from bit <len-1>. This is equivalent to the instruction // [SU]BFIZ Rtmp, Rreg, #shift, #len // It may also be seen as a sign/zero extend followed by a shift: // LSL(Extend(val<len-1:0>, N, unsigned), shift); len = Min(len, N - shift); return Extend(val<len-1:0> : Zeros(shift), N, unsigned);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/branchextendreg/eret/AArch64.ExceptionReturnExtendType

// AArch64.ExceptionReturn() // =========================enumeration AArch64.ExceptionReturn(bits(64) new_pc, bits(32) spsr)ExtendType { SynchronizeContext(); sync_errors =ExtendType_SXTB, HaveIESB() &&ExtendType_SXTH, SCTLR[].IESB == '1'; ifExtendType_SXTW, HaveDoubleFaultExt() then sync_errors = sync_errors || (SCR_EL3.EA == '1' && SCR_EL3.NMEA == '1' && PSTATE.EL ==ExtendType_SXTX, EL3); if sync_errors thenExtendType_UXTB, SynchronizeErrors(); iesb_req = TRUE;ExtendType_UXTH, TakeUnmaskedPhysicalSErrorInterrupts(iesb_req); // Attempts to change to an illegal state will invoke the Illegal Execution state mechanismExtendType_UXTW, SetPSTATEFromPSR(spsr); ClearExclusiveLocal(ProcessorID()); SendEventLocal(); if PSTATE.IL == '1' && spsr<4> == '1' && spsr<20> == '0' then // If the exception return is illegal, PC[63:32,1:0] are UNKNOWN new_pc<63:32> = bits(32) UNKNOWN; new_pc<1:0> = bits(2) UNKNOWN; elsif UsingAArch32() then // Return to AArch32 // ELR_ELx[1:0] or ELR_ELx[0] are treated as being 0, depending on the target instruction set state if PSTATE.T == '1' then new_pc<0> = '0'; // T32 else new_pc<1:0> = '00'; // A32 else // Return to AArch64 // ELR_ELx[63:56] might include a tag new_pc = AArch64.BranchAddr(new_pc); if UsingAArch32() then // 32 most significant bits are ignored. BranchTo(new_pc<31:0>, BranchType_ERET); else BranchToAddr(new_pc, BranchType_ERET);ExtendType_UXTX};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/countopfloat/CountOparithmetic/max-min/fpmaxminop/FPMaxMinOp

enumeration CountOp {FPMaxMinOp {CountOp_CLZ,FPMaxMinOp_MAX, CountOp_CLS,FPMaxMinOp_MIN, CountOp_CNT};FPMaxMinOp_MAXNUM,FPMaxMinOp_MINNUM};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/extendregfloat/DecodeRegExtendarithmetic/unary/fpunaryop/FPUnaryOp

// DecodeRegExtend() // ================= // Decode a register extension option ExtendTypeenumeration DecodeRegExtend(bits(3) op) case op of when '000' returnFPUnaryOp { ExtendType_UXTB; when '001' returnFPUnaryOp_ABS, ExtendType_UXTH; when '010' returnFPUnaryOp_MOV, ExtendType_UXTW; when '011' returnFPUnaryOp_NEG, ExtendType_UXTX; when '100' return ExtendType_SXTB; when '101' return ExtendType_SXTH; when '110' return ExtendType_SXTW; when '111' return ExtendType_SXTX;FPUnaryOp_SQRT};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/extendregfloat/ExtendRegconvert/fpconvop/FPConvOp

// ExtendReg() // =========== // Perform a register extension and shift bits(N)enumeration ExtendReg(integer reg,FPConvOp { ExtendType exttype, integer shift) assert shift >= 0 && shift <= 4; bits(N) val =FPConvOp_CVT_FtoI, X[reg]; boolean unsigned; integer len; case exttype of whenFPConvOp_CVT_ItoF, ExtendType_SXTB unsigned = FALSE; len = 8; whenFPConvOp_MOV_FtoI, ExtendType_SXTH unsigned = FALSE; len = 16; whenFPConvOp_MOV_ItoF , ExtendType_SXTW unsigned = FALSE; len = 32; when ExtendType_SXTX unsigned = FALSE; len = 64; when ExtendType_UXTB unsigned = TRUE; len = 8; when ExtendType_UXTH unsigned = TRUE; len = 16; when ExtendType_UXTW unsigned = TRUE; len = 32; when ExtendType_UXTX unsigned = TRUE; len = 64; // Note the extended width of the intermediate value and // that sign extension occurs from bit <len+shift-1>, not // from bit <len-1>. This is equivalent to the instruction // [SU]BFIZ Rtmp, Rreg, #shift, #len // It may also be seen as a sign/zero extend followed by a shift: // LSL(Extend(val<len-1:0>, N, unsigned), shift); len = Min(len, N - shift); return Extend(val<len-1:0> : Zeros(shift), N, unsigned);FPConvOp_CVT_FtoI_JS };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/extendreginteger/ExtendTypebitfield/bfxpreferred/BFXPreferred

enumeration// BFXPreferred() // ============== // // Return TRUE if UBFX or SBFX is the preferred disassembly of a // UBFM or SBFM bitfield instruction. Must exclude more specific // aliases UBFIZ, SBFIZ, UXT[BH], SXT[BHW], LSL, LSR and ASR. boolean ExtendType {BFXPreferred(bit sf, bit uns, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr) integer S =ExtendType_SXTB,(imms); integer R = ExtendType_SXTH,(immr); // must not match UBFIZ/SBFIX alias if ExtendType_SXTW,(imms) < ExtendType_SXTX, ExtendType_UXTB, ExtendType_UXTH, ExtendType_UXTW, ExtendType_UXTX};(immr) then return FALSE; // must not match LSR/ASR/LSL alias (imms == 31 or 63) if imms == sf:'11111' then return FALSE; // must not match UXTx/SXTx alias if immr == '000000' then // must not match 32-bit UXT[BH] or SXT[BH] if sf == '0' && imms IN {'000111', '001111'} then return FALSE; // must not match 64-bit SXT[BHW] if sf:uns == '10' && imms IN {'000111', '001111', '011111'} then return FALSE; // must be UBFX/SBFX alias return TRUE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/floatinteger/arithmeticbitmasks/max-min/fpmaxminop/FPMaxMinOpDecodeBitMasks

enumeration// DecodeBitMasks() // ================ // Decode AArch64 bitfield and logical immediate masks which use a similar encoding structure (bits(M), bits(M)) FPMaxMinOp {DecodeBitMasks(bit immN, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr, boolean immediate) bits(64) tmask, wmask; bits(6) tmask_and, wmask_and; bits(6) tmask_or, wmask_or; bits(6) levels; // Compute log2 of element size // 2^len must be in range [2, M] len =FPMaxMinOp_MAX,(immN:NOT(imms)); if len < 1 then UNDEFINED; assert M >= (1 << len); // Determine S, R and S - R parameters levels = FPMaxMinOp_MIN,( FPMaxMinOp_MAXNUM,(len), 6); // For logical immediates an all-ones value of S is reserved // since it would generate a useless all-ones result (many times) if immediate && (imms AND levels) == levels then UNDEFINED; S = (imms AND levels); R = UInt(immr AND levels); diff = S - R; // 6-bit subtract with borrow // From a software perspective, the remaining code is equivalant to: // esize = 1 << len; // d = UInt(diff<len-1:0>); // welem = ZeroExtend(Ones(S + 1), esize); // telem = ZeroExtend(Ones(d + 1), esize); // wmask = Replicate(ROR(welem, R)); // tmask = Replicate(telem); // return (wmask, tmask); // Compute "top mask" tmask_and = diff<5:0> OR NOT(levels); tmask_or = diff<5:0> AND levels; tmask = Ones(64); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<0>, 1) : Ones(1), 32)) OR Replicate(Zeros(1) : Replicate(tmask_or<0>, 1), 32)); // optimization of first step: // tmask = Replicate(tmask_and<0> : '1', 32); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<1>, 2) : Ones(2), 16)) OR Replicate(Zeros(2) : Replicate(tmask_or<1>, 2), 16)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<2>, 4) : Ones(4), 8)) OR Replicate(Zeros(4) : Replicate(tmask_or<2>, 4), 8)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<3>, 8) : Ones(8), 4)) OR Replicate(Zeros(8) : Replicate(tmask_or<3>, 8), 4)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<4>, 16) : Ones(16), 2)) OR Replicate(Zeros(16) : Replicate(tmask_or<4>, 16), 2)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<5>, 32) : Ones(32), 1)) OR Replicate(Zeros(32) : Replicate(tmask_or<5>, 32), 1)); // Compute "wraparound mask" wmask_and = immr OR NOT(levels); wmask_or = immr AND levels; wmask = Zeros(64); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(1) : Replicate(wmask_and<0>, 1), 32)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<0>, 1) : Zeros(1), 32)); // optimization of first step: // wmask = Replicate(wmask_or<0> : '0', 32); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(2) : Replicate(wmask_and<1>, 2), 16)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<1>, 2) : Zeros(2), 16)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(4) : Replicate(wmask_and<2>, 4), 8)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<2>, 4) : Zeros(4), 8)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(8) : Replicate(wmask_and<3>, 8), 4)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<3>, 8) : Zeros(8), 4)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(16) : Replicate(wmask_and<4>, 16), 2)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<4>, 16) : Zeros(16), 2)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(32) : Replicate(wmask_and<5>, 32), 1)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<5>, 32) : ZerosFPMaxMinOp_MINNUM};(32), 1)); if diff<6> != '0' then // borrow from S - R wmask = wmask AND tmask; else wmask = wmask OR tmask; return (wmask<M-1:0>, tmask<M-1:0>);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/floatinteger/arithmeticins-ext/unaryinsert/fpunaryopmovewide/FPUnaryOpmovewideop/MoveWideOp

enumeration FPUnaryOp {MoveWideOp {FPUnaryOp_ABS,MoveWideOp_N, FPUnaryOp_MOV,MoveWideOp_Z, FPUnaryOp_NEG,MoveWideOp_K}; FPUnaryOp_SQRT};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/floatinteger/convertlogical/fpconvopmovwpreferred/FPConvOpMoveWidePreferred

enumeration// MoveWidePreferred() // =================== // // Return TRUE if a bitmask immediate encoding would generate an immediate // value that could also be represented by a single MOVZ or MOVN instruction. // Used as a condition for the preferred MOV<-ORR alias. boolean FPConvOp {MoveWidePreferred(bit sf, bit immN, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr) integer S =FPConvOp_CVT_FtoI,(imms); integer R = FPConvOp_CVT_ItoF, FPConvOp_MOV_FtoI, FPConvOp_MOV_ItoF , FPConvOp_CVT_FtoI_JS };(immr); integer width = if sf == '1' then 64 else 32; // element size must equal total immediate size if sf == '1' && immN:imms != '1xxxxxx' then return FALSE; if sf == '0' && immN:imms != '00xxxxx' then return FALSE; // for MOVZ must contain no more than 16 ones if S < 16 then // ones must not span halfword boundary when rotated return (-R MOD 16) <= (15 - S); // for MOVN must contain no more than 16 zeros if S >= width - 15 then // zeros must not span halfword boundary when rotated return (R MOD 16) <= (S - (width - 15)); return FALSE;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integer/bitfieldshiftreg/bfxpreferred/BFXPreferredDecodeShift

// BFXPreferred() // ============== // // Return TRUE if UBFX or SBFX is the preferred disassembly of a // UBFM or SBFM bitfield instruction. Must exclude more specific // aliases UBFIZ, SBFIZ, UXT[BH], SXT[BHW], LSL, LSR and ASR. // DecodeShift() // ============= // Decode shift encodings booleanShiftType BFXPreferred(bit sf, bit uns, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr) integer S =DecodeShift(bits(2) op) case op of when '00' return UIntShiftType_LSL(imms); integer R =; when '01' return UIntShiftType_LSR(immr); // must not match UBFIZ/SBFIX alias if; when '10' return UIntShiftType_ASR(imms) <; when '11' return UIntShiftType_ROR(immr) then return FALSE; // must not match LSR/ASR/LSL alias (imms == 31 or 63) if imms == sf:'11111' then return FALSE; // must not match UXTx/SXTx alias if immr == '000000' then // must not match 32-bit UXT[BH] or SXT[BH] if sf == '0' && imms IN {'000111', '001111'} then return FALSE; // must not match 64-bit SXT[BHW] if sf:uns == '10' && imms IN {'000111', '001111', '011111'} then return FALSE; // must be UBFX/SBFX alias return TRUE;;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integer/bitmasksshiftreg/DecodeBitMasksShiftReg

// DecodeBitMasks() // ================ // ShiftReg() // ========== // Perform shift of a register operand // Decode AArch64 bitfield and logical immediate masks which use a similar encoding structure (bits(M), bits(M))bits(N) DecodeBitMasks(bit immN, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr, boolean immediate) bits(64) tmask, wmask; bits(6) tmask_and, wmask_and; bits(6) tmask_or, wmask_or; bits(6) levels; // Compute log2 of element size // 2^len must be in range [2, M] len =ShiftReg(integer reg, HighestSetBitShiftType(immN:NOT(imms)); if len < 1 then UNDEFINED; assert M >= (1 << len); // Determine S, R and S - R parameters levels =shiftype, integer amount) bits(N) result = ZeroExtendX([reg]; case shiftype of whenOnesShiftType_LSL(len), 6); // For logical immediates an all-ones value of S is reserved // since it would generate a useless all-ones result (many times) if immediate && (imms AND levels) == levels then UNDEFINED; S =result = UIntLSL(imms AND levels); R =(result, amount); when UIntShiftType_LSR(immr AND levels); diff = S - R; // 6-bit subtract with borrow // From a software perspective, the remaining code is equivalant to: // esize = 1 << len; // d = UInt(diff<len-1:0>); // welem = ZeroExtend(Ones(S + 1), esize); // telem = ZeroExtend(Ones(d + 1), esize); // wmask = Replicate(ROR(welem, R)); // tmask = Replicate(telem); // return (wmask, tmask); // Compute "top mask" tmask_and = diff<5:0> OR NOT(levels); tmask_or = diff<5:0> AND levels; tmask =result = OnesLSR(64); tmask = ((tmask AND(result, amount); when ReplicateShiftType_ASR(result =ReplicateASR(tmask_and<0>, 1) :(result, amount); when OnesShiftType_ROR(1), 32)) ORresult = ReplicateROR(Zeros(1) : Replicate(tmask_or<0>, 1), 32)); // optimization of first step: // tmask = Replicate(tmask_and<0> : '1', 32); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<1>, 2) : Ones(2), 16)) OR Replicate(Zeros(2) : Replicate(tmask_or<1>, 2), 16)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<2>, 4) : Ones(4), 8)) OR Replicate(Zeros(4) : Replicate(tmask_or<2>, 4), 8)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<3>, 8) : Ones(8), 4)) OR Replicate(Zeros(8) : Replicate(tmask_or<3>, 8), 4)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<4>, 16) : Ones(16), 2)) OR Replicate(Zeros(16) : Replicate(tmask_or<4>, 16), 2)); tmask = ((tmask AND Replicate(Replicate(tmask_and<5>, 32) : Ones(32), 1)) OR Replicate(Zeros(32) : Replicate(tmask_or<5>, 32), 1)); // Compute "wraparound mask" wmask_and = immr OR NOT(levels); wmask_or = immr AND levels; wmask = Zeros(64); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(1) : Replicate(wmask_and<0>, 1), 32)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<0>, 1) : Zeros(1), 32)); // optimization of first step: // wmask = Replicate(wmask_or<0> : '0', 32); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(2) : Replicate(wmask_and<1>, 2), 16)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<1>, 2) : Zeros(2), 16)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(4) : Replicate(wmask_and<2>, 4), 8)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<2>, 4) : Zeros(4), 8)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(8) : Replicate(wmask_and<3>, 8), 4)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<3>, 8) : Zeros(8), 4)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(16) : Replicate(wmask_and<4>, 16), 2)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<4>, 16) : Zeros(16), 2)); wmask = ((wmask AND Replicate(Ones(32) : Replicate(wmask_and<5>, 32), 1)) OR Replicate(Replicate(wmask_or<5>, 32) : Zeros(32), 1)); if diff<6> != '0' then // borrow from S - R wmask = wmask AND tmask; else wmask = wmask OR tmask; return (wmask<M-1:0>, tmask<M-1:0>);(result, amount); return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integer/ins-extshiftreg/insert/movewide/movewideop/MoveWideOpShiftType

enumeration MoveWideOp {ShiftType {MoveWideOp_N,ShiftType_LSL, MoveWideOp_Z,ShiftType_LSR, MoveWideOp_K};ShiftType_ASR,ShiftType_ROR};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integerlogicalop/logical/movwpreferred/MoveWidePreferredLogicalOp

// MoveWidePreferred() // =================== // // Return TRUE if a bitmask immediate encoding would generate an immediate // value that could also be represented by a single MOVZ or MOVN instruction. // Used as a condition for the preferred MOV<-ORR alias. booleanenumeration MoveWidePreferred(bit sf, bit immN, bits(6) imms, bits(6) immr) integer S =LogicalOp { UInt(imms); integer R =LogicalOp_AND, LogicalOp_EOR, UInt(immr); integer width = if sf == '1' then 64 else 32; // element size must equal total immediate size if sf == '1' && immN:imms != '1xxxxxx' then return FALSE; if sf == '0' && immN:imms != '00xxxxx' then return FALSE; // for MOVZ must contain no more than 16 ones if S < 16 then // ones must not span halfword boundary when rotated return (-R MOD 16) <= (15 - S); // for MOVN must contain no more than 16 zeros if S >= width - 15 then // zeros must not span halfword boundary when rotated return (R MOD 16) <= (S - (width - 15)); return FALSE;LogicalOp_ORR};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integermemory/shiftregmemop/DecodeShiftMemAtomicOp

// DecodeShift() // ============= // Decode shift encodings ShiftTypeenumeration DecodeShift(bits(2) op) case op of when '00' returnMemAtomicOp { ShiftType_LSL; when '01' returnMemAtomicOp_ADD, ShiftType_LSR; when '10' returnMemAtomicOp_BIC, ShiftType_ASR; when '11' returnMemAtomicOp_EOR, MemAtomicOp_ORR, MemAtomicOp_SMAX, MemAtomicOp_SMIN, MemAtomicOp_UMAX, MemAtomicOp_UMIN, ShiftType_ROR;MemAtomicOp_SWP};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integermemory/shiftregmemop/ShiftRegMemOp

// ShiftReg() // ========== // Perform shift of a register operand bits(N)enumeration ShiftReg(integer reg,MemOp { ShiftType shiftype, integer amount) bits(N) result =MemOp_LOAD, X[reg]; case shiftype of whenMemOp_STORE, ShiftType_LSL result = LSL(result, amount); when ShiftType_LSR result = LSR(result, amount); when ShiftType_ASR result = ASR(result, amount); when ShiftType_ROR result = ROR(result, amount); return result;MemOp_PREFETCH};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/integermemory/shiftregprefetch/ShiftTypePrefetch

enumeration// Prefetch() // ========== // Decode and execute the prefetch hint on ADDRESS specified by PRFOP ShiftType {Prefetch(bits(64) address, bits(5) prfop)ShiftType_LSL,hint; integer target; boolean stream; case prfop<4:3> of when '00' hint = ShiftType_LSR,; // PLD: prefetch for load when '01' hint = ShiftType_ASR,; // PLI: preload instructions when '10' hint = ; // PST: prepare for store when '11' return; // unallocated hint target = UInt(prfop<2:1>); // target cache level stream = (prfop<0> != '0'); // streaming (non-temporal) Hint_PrefetchShiftType_ROR};(address, hint, target, stream); return;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/logicalopsystem/LogicalOpbarriers/barrierop/MemBarrierOp

enumeration LogicalOp {MemBarrierOp {LogicalOp_AND,MemBarrierOp_DSB // Data Synchronization Barrier , LogicalOp_EOR,MemBarrierOp_DMB // Data Memory Barrier , LogicalOp_ORR};MemBarrierOp_ISB // Instruction Synchronization Barrier ,MemBarrierOp_SSBB // Speculative Synchronization Barrier to VA , MemBarrierOp_PSSBB // Speculative Synchronization Barrier to PA , MemBarrierOp_SB // Speculation Barrier };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/memorysystem/memophints/MemAtomicOpsyshintop/SystemHintOp

enumeration MemAtomicOp {SystemHintOp {MemAtomicOp_ADD,SystemHintOp_NOP, MemAtomicOp_BIC,SystemHintOp_YIELD, MemAtomicOp_EOR,SystemHintOp_WFE, MemAtomicOp_ORR,SystemHintOp_WFI, MemAtomicOp_SMAX,SystemHintOp_SEV, MemAtomicOp_SMIN,SystemHintOp_SEVL, MemAtomicOp_UMAX,SystemHintOp_DGH, MemAtomicOp_UMIN,SystemHintOp_ESB, MemAtomicOp_SWP};SystemHintOp_PSB,SystemHintOp_TSB, SystemHintOp_BTI, SystemHintOp_CSDB };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/memorysystem/memopregister/MemOpcpsr/pstatefield/PSTATEField

enumeration MemOp {PSTATEField {MemOp_LOAD,PSTATEField_DAIFSet, MemOp_STORE,PSTATEField_DAIFClr, MemOp_PREFETCH};PSTATEField_PAN, // Armv8.1PSTATEField_UAO, // Armv8.2 PSTATEField_DIT, // Armv8.4 PSTATEField_SSBS, PSTATEField_TCO, // Armv8.5 PSTATEField_SP };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/memorysystem/prefetchsysops/Prefetchsysop/SysOp

// Prefetch() // ========== // SysOp() // ======= // Decode and execute the prefetch hint on ADDRESS specified by PRFOPSystemOp Prefetch(bits(64) address, bits(5) prfop)SysOp(bits(3) op1, bits(4) CRn, bits(4) CRm, bits(3) op2) case op1:CRn:CRm:op2 of when '000 0111 1000 000' return PrefetchHintSys_AT hint; integer target; boolean stream; case prfop<4:3> of when '00' hint =; // S1E1R when '100 0111 1000 000' return Prefetch_READSys_AT; // PLD: prefetch for load when '01' hint =; // S1E2R when '110 0111 1000 000' return Prefetch_EXECSys_AT; // PLI: preload instructions when '10' hint =; // S1E3R when '000 0111 1000 001' return Prefetch_WRITESys_AT; // PST: prepare for store when '11' return; // unallocated hint target =; // S1E1W when '100 0111 1000 001' return UIntSys_AT(prfop<2:1>); // target cache level stream = (prfop<0> != '0'); // streaming (non-temporal); // S1E2W when '110 0111 1000 001' return ; // S1E3W when '000 0111 1000 010' return Sys_AT; // S1E0R when '000 0111 1000 011' return Sys_AT; // S1E0W when '100 0111 1000 100' return Sys_AT; // S12E1R when '100 0111 1000 101' return Sys_AT; // S12E1W when '100 0111 1000 110' return Sys_AT; // S12E0R when '100 0111 1000 111' return Sys_AT; // S12E0W when '011 0111 0100 001' return Sys_DC; // ZVA when '000 0111 0110 001' return Sys_DC; // IVAC when '000 0111 0110 010' return Sys_DC; // ISW when '011 0111 1010 001' return Sys_DC; // CVAC when '000 0111 1010 010' return Sys_DC; // CSW when '011 0111 1011 001' return Sys_DC; // CVAU when '011 0111 1110 001' return Sys_DC; // CIVAC when '000 0111 1110 010' return Sys_DC; // CISW when '011 0111 1101 001' return Sys_DC; // CVADP when '000 0111 0001 000' return Sys_IC; // IALLUIS when '000 0111 0101 000' return Sys_IC; // IALLU when '011 0111 0101 001' return Sys_IC; // IVAU when '100 1000 0000 001' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2E1IS when '100 1000 0000 101' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2LE1IS when '000 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLE1IS when '100 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE2IS when '110 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE3IS when '000 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE1IS when '100 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE2IS when '110 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE3IS when '000 1000 0011 010' return Sys_TLBI; // ASIDE1IS when '000 1000 0011 011' return Sys_TLBI; // VAAE1IS when '100 1000 0011 100' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE1IS when '000 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE1IS when '100 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE2IS when '110 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE3IS when '100 1000 0011 110' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLS12E1IS when '000 1000 0011 111' return Sys_TLBI; // VAALE1IS when '100 1000 0100 001' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2E1 when '100 1000 0100 101' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2LE1 when '000 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLE1 when '100 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE2 when '110 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE3 when '000 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE1 when '100 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE2 when '110 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE3 when '000 1000 0111 010' return Sys_TLBI; // ASIDE1 when '000 1000 0111 011' return Sys_TLBI; // VAAE1 when '100 1000 0111 100' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE1 when '000 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE1 when '100 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE2 when '110 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE3 when '100 1000 0111 110' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLS12E1 when '000 1000 0111 111' return Sys_TLBI; // VAALE1 return Sys_SYSHint_PrefetchSys_AT(address, hint, target, stream); return;;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/system/barrierssysops/barrieropsysop/MemBarrierOpSystemOp

enumeration MemBarrierOp {SystemOp { MemBarrierOp_DSB // Data Synchronization Barrier ,Sys_AT, MemBarrierOp_DMB // Data Memory Barrier ,Sys_DC, MemBarrierOp_ISB // Instruction Synchronization Barrier ,Sys_IC, MemBarrierOp_SSBB // Speculative Synchronization Barrier to VA ,Sys_TLBI, MemBarrierOp_PSSBB // Speculative Synchronization Barrier to PA ,Sys_SYS}; MemBarrierOp_SB // Speculation Barrier };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/systemvector/hintsarithmetic/syshintopbinary/SystemHintOpuniform/logical/bsl-eor/vbitop/VBitOp
