Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/systemvector/registerarithmetic/cpsrunary/pstatefieldcmp/PSTATEFieldcompareop/CompareOp

enumeration PSTATEField {CompareOp {PSTATEField_DAIFSet,CompareOp_GT, PSTATEField_DAIFClr,CompareOp_GE, PSTATEField_PAN, // Armv8.1CompareOp_EQ, PSTATEField_UAO, // Armv8.2CompareOp_LE, PSTATEField_DIT, // Armv8.4CompareOp_LT}; PSTATEField_SSBS, PSTATEField_TCO, // Armv8.5 PSTATEField_SP };

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/systemvector/sysopslogical/sysopimmediateop/SysOpImmediateOp

// SysOp() // ======= SystemOpenumeration SysOp(bits(3) op1, bits(4) CRn, bits(4) CRm, bits(3) op2) case op1:CRn:CRm:op2 of when '000 0111 1000 000' returnImmediateOp { Sys_AT; // S1E1R when '100 0111 1000 000' returnImmediateOp_MOVI, Sys_AT; // S1E2R when '110 0111 1000 000' returnImmediateOp_MVNI, Sys_AT; // S1E3R when '000 0111 1000 001' returnImmediateOp_ORR, Sys_AT; // S1E1W when '100 0111 1000 001' return Sys_AT; // S1E2W when '110 0111 1000 001' return Sys_AT; // S1E3W when '000 0111 1000 010' return Sys_AT; // S1E0R when '000 0111 1000 011' return Sys_AT; // S1E0W when '100 0111 1000 100' return Sys_AT; // S12E1R when '100 0111 1000 101' return Sys_AT; // S12E1W when '100 0111 1000 110' return Sys_AT; // S12E0R when '100 0111 1000 111' return Sys_AT; // S12E0W when '011 0111 0100 001' return Sys_DC; // ZVA when '000 0111 0110 001' return Sys_DC; // IVAC when '000 0111 0110 010' return Sys_DC; // ISW when '011 0111 1010 001' return Sys_DC; // CVAC when '000 0111 1010 010' return Sys_DC; // CSW when '011 0111 1011 001' return Sys_DC; // CVAU when '011 0111 1110 001' return Sys_DC; // CIVAC when '000 0111 1110 010' return Sys_DC; // CISW when '011 0111 1101 001' return Sys_DC; // CVADP when '000 0111 0001 000' return Sys_IC; // IALLUIS when '000 0111 0101 000' return Sys_IC; // IALLU when '011 0111 0101 001' return Sys_IC; // IVAU when '100 1000 0000 001' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2E1IS when '100 1000 0000 101' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2LE1IS when '000 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLE1IS when '100 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE2IS when '110 1000 0011 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE3IS when '000 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE1IS when '100 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE2IS when '110 1000 0011 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE3IS when '000 1000 0011 010' return Sys_TLBI; // ASIDE1IS when '000 1000 0011 011' return Sys_TLBI; // VAAE1IS when '100 1000 0011 100' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE1IS when '000 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE1IS when '100 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE2IS when '110 1000 0011 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE3IS when '100 1000 0011 110' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLS12E1IS when '000 1000 0011 111' return Sys_TLBI; // VAALE1IS when '100 1000 0100 001' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2E1 when '100 1000 0100 101' return Sys_TLBI; // IPAS2LE1 when '000 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLE1 when '100 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE2 when '110 1000 0111 000' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE3 when '000 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE1 when '100 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE2 when '110 1000 0111 001' return Sys_TLBI; // VAE3 when '000 1000 0111 010' return Sys_TLBI; // ASIDE1 when '000 1000 0111 011' return Sys_TLBI; // VAAE1 when '100 1000 0111 100' return Sys_TLBI; // ALLE1 when '000 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE1 when '100 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE2 when '110 1000 0111 101' return Sys_TLBI; // VALE3 when '100 1000 0111 110' return Sys_TLBI; // VMALLS12E1 when '000 1000 0111 111' return Sys_TLBI; // VAALE1 return Sys_SYS;ImmediateOp_BIC};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/systemvector/sysopsreduce/sysopreduceop/SystemOpReduce

enumeration// Reduce() // ======== bits(esize) SystemOp {Reduce(Sys_AT,op, bits(N) input, integer esize) integer half; bits(esize) hi; bits(esize) lo; bits(esize) result; if N == esize then return input<esize-1:0>; half = N DIV 2; hi = Sys_DC,(op, input<N-1:half>, esize); lo = Sys_IC,(op, input<half-1:0>, esize); case op of when Sys_TLBI,result = (lo, hi, FPCR); when ReduceOp_FMAXNUM result = FPMaxNum(lo, hi, FPCR); when ReduceOp_FMIN result = FPMin(lo, hi, FPCR); when ReduceOp_FMAX result = FPMax(lo, hi, FPCR); when ReduceOp_FADD result = FPAdd(lo, hi, FPCR); when ReduceOp_ADDSys_SYS};result = lo + hi; return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrs/vector/arithmeticreduce/binaryreduceop/uniform/logical/bsl-eor/vbitop/VBitOpReduceOp

enumeration VBitOp {ReduceOp {VBitOp_VBIF,ReduceOp_FMINNUM, VBitOp_VBIT,ReduceOp_FMAXNUM, VBitOp_VBSL,ReduceOp_FMIN, VBitOp_VEOR};ReduceOp_FMAX,ReduceOp_FADD, ReduceOp_ADD};

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrstranslation/vectorattrs/arithmetic/unary/cmp/compareop/CompareOpAArch64.CombineS1S2Desc

enumeration// AArch64.CombineS1S2Desc() // ========================= // Combines the address descriptors from stage 1 and stage 2 AddressDescriptor CompareOp {AArch64.CombineS1S2Desc(CompareOp_GT,s1desc, CompareOp_GE,s2desc) CompareOp_EQ,result; result.paddress = s2desc.paddress; apply_force_writeback = CompareOp_LE,() && HCR_EL2.FWB == '1'; if (s1desc) || IsFault(s2desc) then result = if IsFault(s1desc) then s1desc else s2desc; else result.fault = AArch64.NoFault(); if s2desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device || ( (apply_force_writeback && s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device && s2desc.memattrs.inner.attrs != '10') || (!apply_force_writeback && s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device) ) then result.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Device; if s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Normal then result.memattrs.device = s2desc.memattrs.device; elsif s2desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Normal then result.memattrs.device = s1desc.memattrs.device; else // Both Device result.memattrs.device = CombineS1S2Device(s1desc.memattrs.device, s2desc.memattrs.device); result.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; else result.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; result.memattrs.device = DeviceType UNKNOWN; if apply_force_writeback then if s2desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Normal && s2desc.memattrs.inner.attrs == '10' then result.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_WB; // force Write-back elsif s2desc.memattrs.inner.attrs == '11' then result.memattrs.inner.attrs = s1desc.memattrs.inner.attrs; else result.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_NC; result.memattrs.outer = result.memattrs.inner; else result.memattrs.inner = CombineS1S2AttrHints(s1desc.memattrs.inner, s2desc.memattrs.inner); result.memattrs.outer = CombineS1S2AttrHints(s1desc.memattrs.outer, s2desc.memattrs.outer); result.memattrs.shareable = (s1desc.memattrs.shareable || s2desc.memattrs.shareable); result.memattrs.outershareable = (s1desc.memattrs.outershareable || s2desc.memattrs.outershareable); result.memattrs.tagged = (s1desc.memattrs.tagged && result.memattrs.inner.attrs == MemAttr_WB && result.memattrs.inner.hints == MemHint_RWA && result.memattrs.outer.attrs == MemAttr_WB && result.memattrs.outer.hints == MemHint_RWA); result.memattrs = MemAttrDefaultsCompareOp_LT};(result.memattrs); return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrstranslation/vectorattrs/logical/immediateop/ImmediateOpAArch64.InstructionDevice

enumeration// AArch64.InstructionDevice() // =========================== // Instruction fetches from memory marked as Device but not execute-never might generate a // Permission Fault but are otherwise treated as if from Normal Non-cacheable memory. AddressDescriptor ImmediateOp {AArch64.InstructionDevice(ImmediateOp_MOVI,addrdesc, bits(64) vaddress, bits(52) ipaddress, integer level, ImmediateOp_MVNI,acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean secondstage, boolean s2fs1walk) c = ImmediateOp_ORR,( ); assert c IN {Constraint_NONE, Constraint_FAULT}; if c == Constraint_FAULT then addrdesc.fault = AArch64.PermissionFault(ipaddress, boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, iswrite, secondstage, s2fs1walk); else addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_NC; addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_No; addrdesc.memattrs.outer = addrdesc.memattrs.inner; addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; addrdesc.memattrs = MemAttrDefaultsImmediateOp_BIC};(addrdesc.memattrs); return addrdesc;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrstranslation/vectorattrs/reduce/reduceop/ReduceAArch64.S1AttrDecode

// Reduce() // ======== // AArch64.S1AttrDecode() // ====================== // Converts the Stage 1 attribute fields, using the MAIR, to orthogonal // attributes and hints. bits(esize)MemoryAttributes Reduce(AArch64.S1AttrDecode(bits(2) SH, bits(3) attr,ReduceOpAccType op, bits(N) input, integer esize) integer half; bits(esize) hi; bits(esize) lo; bits(esize) result; if N == esize then return input<esize-1:0>; half = N DIV 2; hi =acctype) ReduceMemoryAttributes(op, input<N-1:half>, esize); lo =memattrs; mair = ReduceMAIR(op, input<half-1:0>, esize); case op of when[]; index = 8 * ReduceOp_FMINNUMUInt result =(attr); attrfield = mair<index+7:index>; memattrs.tagged = FALSE; if ((attrfield<7:4> != '0000' && attrfield<7:4> != '1111' && attrfield<3:0> == '0000') || (attrfield<7:4> == '0000' && attrfield<3:0> != 'xx00')) then // Reserved, maps to an allocated value (-, attrfield) = FPMinNumConstrainUnpredictableBits(lo, hi, FPCR); when( ReduceOp_FMAXNUMUnpredictable_RESMAIR result =); if ! FPMaxNumHaveMTEExt(lo, hi, FPCR); when() && attrfield<7:4> == '1111' && attrfield<3:0> == '0000' then // Reserved, maps to an allocated value (-, attrfield) = ReduceOp_FMINConstrainUnpredictableBits result =( FPMinUnpredictable_RESMAIR(lo, hi, FPCR); when); if attrfield<7:4> == '0000' then // Device memattrs.memtype = ReduceOp_FMAXMemType_Device result =; case attrfield<3:0> of when '0000' memattrs.device = FPMaxDeviceType_nGnRnE(lo, hi, FPCR); when; when '0100' memattrs.device = ReduceOp_FADDDeviceType_nGnRE result =; when '1000' memattrs.device = FPAddDeviceType_nGRE(lo, hi, FPCR); when; when '1100' memattrs.device = ; otherwise Unreachable(); // Reserved, handled above elsif attrfield<3:0> != '0000' then // Normal memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; memattrs.outer = LongConvertAttrsHints(attrfield<7:4>, acctype); memattrs.inner = LongConvertAttrsHints(attrfield<3:0>, acctype); memattrs.shareable = SH<1> == '1'; memattrs.outershareable = SH == '10'; elsif HaveMTEExt() && attrfield == '11110000' then // Normal, Tagged if WB-RWA memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; memattrs.outer = LongConvertAttrsHints('1111', acctype); // WB_RWA memattrs.inner = LongConvertAttrsHints('1111', acctype); // WB_RWA memattrs.shareable = SH<1> == '1'; memattrs.outershareable = SH == '10'; memattrs.tagged = (memattrs.inner.attrs == MemAttr_WB && memattrs.inner.hints == MemHint_RWA && memattrs.outer.attrs == MemAttr_WB && memattrs.outer.hints == MemHint_RWA); else Unreachable(); // Reserved, handled above return MemAttrDefaultsReduceOp_ADDDeviceType_GRE result = lo + hi; return result;(memattrs);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/instrstranslation/vectorattrs/reduce/reduceop/ReduceOpAArch64.TranslateAddressS1Off

enumeration// AArch64.TranslateAddressS1Off() // =============================== // Called for stage 1 translations when translation is disabled to supply a default translation. // Note that there are additional constraints on instruction prefetching that are not described in // this pseudocode. TLBRecord ReduceOp {AArch64.TranslateAddressS1Off(bits(64) vaddress,ReduceOp_FMINNUM,acctype, boolean iswrite) assert ! ReduceOp_FMAXNUM,( ReduceOp_FMIN,()); ReduceOp_FMAX,result; Top = ReduceOp_FADD,(vaddress, (acctype == ), PSTATE.EL); if !IsZero(vaddress<Top:PAMax()>) then level = 0; ipaddress = bits(52) UNKNOWN; secondstage = FALSE; s2fs1walk = FALSE; result.addrdesc.fault = AArch64.AddressSizeFault(ipaddress,boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, iswrite, secondstage, s2fs1walk); return result; default_cacheable = (HasS2Translation() && HCR_EL2.DC == '1'); if default_cacheable then // Use default cacheable settings result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_WB; // Write-back result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_RWA; result.addrdesc.memattrs.shareable = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outershareable = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = HCR_EL2.DCT == '1'; elsif acctype != AccType_IFETCH then // Treat data as Device result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Device; result.addrdesc.memattrs.device = DeviceType_nGnRnE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner = MemAttrHints UNKNOWN; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; else // Instruction cacheability controlled by SCTLR_ELx.I cacheable = SCTLR[].I == '1'; result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; if cacheable then result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_WT; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_RA; else result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_NC; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_No; result.addrdesc.memattrs.shareable = TRUE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outershareable = TRUE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outer = result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner; result.addrdesc.memattrs = MemAttrDefaults(result.addrdesc.memattrs); result.perms.ap = bits(3) UNKNOWN; result.perms.xn = '0'; result.perms.pxn = '0'; result.nG = bit UNKNOWN; result.contiguous = boolean UNKNOWN; result.domain = bits(4) UNKNOWN; result.level = integer UNKNOWN; result.blocksize = integer UNKNOWN; result.addrdesc.paddress.address = vaddress<51:0>; result.addrdesc.paddress.NS = if IsSecure() then '0' else '1'; result.addrdesc.fault = AArch64.NoFaultReduceOp_ADD};(); return result;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/attrschecks/AArch64.CombineS1S2DescAArch64.AccessIsPrivileged

// AArch64.CombineS1S2Desc() // ========================= // Combines the address descriptors from stage 1 and stage 2 // AArch64.AccessIsPrivileged() // ============================ AddressDescriptorboolean AArch64.CombineS1S2Desc(AArch64.AccessIsPrivileged(AddressDescriptorAccType s1desc,acctype) el = AddressDescriptorAArch64.AccessUsesEL s2desc)(acctype); if el == AddressDescriptorEL0 result; result.paddress = s2desc.paddress; apply_force_writeback =then ispriv = FALSE; elsif el == HaveStage2MemAttrControlEL3() && HCR_EL2.FWB == '1'; ifthen ispriv = TRUE; elsif el == IsFaultEL2(s1desc) ||&& (! IsFaultIsInHost(s2desc) then result = if() || HCR_EL2.TGE == '0') then ispriv = TRUE; elsif IsFaultHaveUAOExt(s1desc) then s1desc else s2desc; () && PSTATE.UAO == '1' then ispriv = TRUE; else result.fault = ispriv = (acctype != AArch64.NoFaultAccType_UNPRIV(); if s2desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device || ( (apply_force_writeback && s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device && s2desc.memattrs.inner.attrs != '10') || (!apply_force_writeback && s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Device) ) then result.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Device; if s1desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Normal then result.memattrs.device = s2desc.memattrs.device; elsif s2desc.memattrs.memtype == MemType_Normal then result.memattrs.device = s1desc.memattrs.device; else // Both Device result.memattrs.device = CombineS1S2Device(s1desc.memattrs.device, s2desc.memattrs.device); result.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; // S1 can be either Normal or Device, S2 is Normal. else result.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; result.memattrs.device = DeviceType UNKNOWN; result.memattrs.inner = CombineS1S2AttrHints(s1desc.memattrs.inner, s2desc.memattrs.inner); result.memattrs.outer = CombineS1S2AttrHints(s1desc.memattrs.outer, s2desc.memattrs.outer); result.memattrs.shareable = (s1desc.memattrs.shareable || s2desc.memattrs.shareable); result.memattrs.outershareable = (s1desc.memattrs.outershareable || s2desc.memattrs.outershareable); result.memattrs.tagged = (s1desc.memattrs.tagged && result.memattrs.inner.attrs == MemAttr_WB && result.memattrs.inner.hints == MemHint_RWA && result.memattrs.outer.attrs == MemAttr_WB && result.memattrs.outer.hints == MemHint_RWA); result.memattrs = MemAttrDefaults(result.memattrs); ); return result; return ispriv;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/attrschecks/AArch64.InstructionDeviceAArch64.AccessUsesEL

// AArch64.InstructionDevice() // =========================== // Instruction fetches from memory marked as Device but not execute-never might generate a // Permission Fault but are otherwise treated as if from Normal Non-cacheable memory. // AArch64.AccessUsesEL() // ====================== // Returns the Exception Level of the regime that will manage the translation for a given access type. AddressDescriptorbits(2) AArch64.InstructionDevice(AArch64.AccessUsesEL(AddressDescriptor addrdesc, bits(64) vaddress, bits(52) ipaddress, integer level, AccType acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean secondstage, boolean s2fs1walk) c =acctype) if acctype == ConstrainUnpredictableAccType_UNPRIV(then returnUnpredictable_INSTRDEVICEEL0); assert c IN {; elsif acctype ==Constraint_NONEAccType_NV2REGISTER,then return Constraint_FAULTEL2}; if c == Constraint_FAULT then addrdesc.fault = AArch64.PermissionFault(ipaddress, boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, iswrite, secondstage, s2fs1walk); else addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = MemType_Normal; addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_NC; addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_No; addrdesc.memattrs.outer = addrdesc.memattrs.inner; addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; addrdesc.memattrs = MemAttrDefaults(addrdesc.memattrs); return addrdesc;; else return PSTATE.EL;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/attrschecks/AArch64.S1AttrDecodeAArch64.CheckPermission

// AArch64.S1AttrDecode() // ====================== // Converts the Stage 1 attribute fields, using the MAIR, to orthogonal // attributes and hints. // AArch64.CheckPermission() // ========================= // Function used for permission checking from AArch64 stage 1 translations MemoryAttributesFaultRecord AArch64.S1AttrDecode(bits(2) SH, bits(3) attr,AArch64.CheckPermission( Permissions perms, bits(64) vaddress, integer level, bit NS, AccType acctype)acctype, boolean iswrite) assert ! MemoryAttributesELUsingAArch32 memattrs; mair =( MAIRS1TranslationRegime[]; index = 8 *()); wxn = UIntSCTLR(attr); attrfield = mair<index+7:index>; [].WXN == '1'; memattrs.tagged = FALSE; if ((attrfield<7:4> != '0000' && attrfield<7:4> != '1111' && attrfield<3:0> == '0000') || (attrfield<7:4> == '0000' && attrfield<3:0> != 'xx00')) then // Reserved, maps to an allocated value (-, attrfield) = if (PSTATE.EL == ConstrainUnpredictableBitsEL0(||Unpredictable_RESMAIRIsInHost); if !() || (PSTATE.EL ==HaveMTEExtEL1() && attrfield<7:4> == '1111' && attrfield<3:0> == '0000' then // Reserved, maps to an allocated value (-, attrfield) =&& ! ConstrainUnpredictableBitsHaveNV2Ext(()) || (PSTATE.EL ==Unpredictable_RESMAIREL1); if attrfield<7:4> == '0000' then // Device memattrs.memtype =&& MemType_DeviceHaveNV2Ext; case attrfield<3:0> of when '0000' memattrs.device =() && (acctype != DeviceType_nGnRnEAccType_NV2REGISTER; when '0100' memattrs.device =|| ! DeviceType_nGnREELIsInHost; when '1000' memattrs.device =( DeviceType_nGREEL2; when '1100' memattrs.device =)))) then priv_r = TRUE; priv_w = perms.ap<2> == '0'; user_r = perms.ap<1> == '1'; user_w = perms.ap<2:1> == '01'; ispriv = DeviceType_GREAArch64.AccessIsPrivileged; otherwise(acctype); pan = if UnreachableHavePANExt(); // Reserved, handled above elsif attrfield<3:0> != '0000' then // Normal memattrs.memtype =() then PSTATE.PAN else '0'; if ( MemType_NormalEL2Enabled; memattrs.outer =() && ((PSTATE.EL == LongConvertAttrsHintsEL1(attrfield<7:4>, acctype); memattrs.inner =&& LongConvertAttrsHintsHaveNVExt(attrfield<3:0>, acctype); memattrs.shareable = SH<1> == '1'; memattrs.outershareable = SH == '10'; elsif() && HCR_EL2.<NV, NV1> == '11') || ( HaveMTEExtHaveNV2Ext() && attrfield == '11110000' then // Normal, Tagged if WB-RWA memattrs.memtype =() && acctype == MemType_NormalAccType_NV2REGISTER; memattrs.outer =&& HCR_EL2.NV2 == '1'))) then pan = '0'; is_ldst = !(acctype IN { LongConvertAttrsHintsAccType_DC('1111', acctype); // WB_RWA memattrs.inner =, LongConvertAttrsHintsAccType_DC_UNPRIV('1111', acctype); // WB_RWA memattrs.shareable = SH<1> == '1'; memattrs.outershareable = SH == '10'; memattrs.tagged = (memattrs.inner.attrs ==, MemAttr_WBAccType_AT && memattrs.inner.hints ==, MemHint_RWAAccType_IFETCH && memattrs.outer.attrs ==}); is_ats1xp = (acctype == MemAttr_WBAccType_AT && memattrs.outer.hints ==&& MemHint_RWAAArch64.ExecutingATS1xPInstr); else()); if pan == '1' && user_r && ispriv && (is_ldst || is_ats1xp) then priv_r = FALSE; priv_w = FALSE; user_xn = perms.xn == '1' || (user_w && wxn); priv_xn = perms.pxn == '1' || (priv_w && wxn) || user_w; if ispriv then (r, w, xn) = (priv_r, priv_w, priv_xn); else (r, w, xn) = (user_r, user_w, user_xn); else // Access from EL2 or EL3 r = TRUE; w = perms.ap<2> == '0'; xn = perms.xn == '1' || (w && wxn); // Restriction on Secure instruction fetch if UnreachableHaveEL(); // Reserved, handled above return( ) && IsSecure() && NS == '1' && SCR_EL3.SIF == '1' then xn = TRUE; if acctype == AccType_IFETCH then fail = xn; failedread = TRUE; elsif acctype IN { AccType_ATOMICRW, AccType_ORDEREDRW, AccType_ORDEREDATOMICRW } then fail = !r || !w; failedread = !r; elsif iswrite then fail = !w; failedread = FALSE; elsif acctype == AccType_DC && PSTATE.EL != EL0 then // DC maintenance instructions operating by VA, cannot fault from stage 1 translation, // other than DC IVAC, which requires write permission, and operations executed at EL0, // which require read permission. fail = FALSE; else fail = !r; failedread = TRUE; if fail then secondstage = FALSE; s2fs1walk = FALSE; ipaddress = bits(52) UNKNOWN; return AArch64.PermissionFault(ipaddress,boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, !failedread, secondstage, s2fs1walk); else return AArch64.NoFaultMemAttrDefaultsEL3(memattrs);();

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/attrschecks/AArch64.TranslateAddressS1OffAArch64.CheckS2Permission

// AArch64.TranslateAddressS1Off() // =============================== // Called for stage 1 translations when translation is disabled to supply a default translation. // Note that there are additional constraints on instruction prefetching that are not described in // this pseudocode. // AArch64.CheckS2Permission() // =========================== // Function used for permission checking from AArch64 stage 2 translations TLBRecordFaultRecord AArch64.TranslateAddressS1Off(bits(64) vaddress,AArch64.CheckS2Permission( Permissions perms, bits(64) vaddress, bits(52) ipaddress, integer level, AccType acctype, boolean iswrite) assert !acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean NS, boolean s2fs1walk, boolean hwupdatewalk) assertELUsingAArch32IsSecureEL2Enabled(() || (S1TranslationRegimeHaveEL());( TLBRecordEL2 result; Top =) && ! AddrTopIsSecure(vaddress, (acctype ==() && ! AccType_IFETCHELUsingAArch32), PSTATE.EL); if !(IsZeroEL2(vaddress<Top:) ) &&PAMax()>) then level = 0; ipaddress = bits(52) UNKNOWN; secondstage = FALSE; s2fs1walk = FALSE; result.addrdesc.fault = AArch64.AddressSizeFault(ipaddress,boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, iswrite, secondstage, s2fs1walk); return result; default_cacheable = (HasS2Translation() && HCR_EL2.DC == '1'); (); if default_cacheable then // Use default cacheable settings result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype = r = perms.ap<1> == '1'; w = perms.ap<2> == '1'; if MemType_NormalHaveExtendedExecuteNeverExt; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs =() then case perms.xn:perms.xxn of when '00' xn = FALSE; when '01' xn = PSTATE.EL == MemAttr_WBEL1; // Write-back result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints =; when '10' xn = TRUE; when '11' xn = PSTATE.EL == MemHint_RWAEL0; result.addrdesc.memattrs.shareable = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outershareable = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = HCR_EL2.DCT == '1'; elsif acctype != else xn = perms.xn == '1'; // Stage 1 walk is checked as a read, regardless of the original type if acctype == AccType_IFETCH then // Treat data as Device result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype =&& !s2fs1walk then fail = xn; failedread = TRUE; elsif (acctype IN { MemType_DeviceAccType_ATOMICRW; result.addrdesc.memattrs.device =, DeviceType_nGnRnEAccType_ORDEREDRW; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner =, MemAttrHintsAccType_ORDEREDATOMICRW UNKNOWN; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; else // Instruction cacheability controlled by SCTLR_ELx.I cacheable =}) && !s2fs1walk then fail = !r || !w; failedread = !r; elsif iswrite && !s2fs1walk then fail = !w; failedread = FALSE; elsif acctype == SCTLRAccType_DC[].I == '1'; result.addrdesc.memattrs.memtype =&& PSTATE.EL != MemType_NormalEL0; if cacheable then result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs =&& !s2fs1walk then // DC maintenance instructions operating by VA, with the exception of DC IVAC, do // not generate Permission faults from stage 2 translation, other than when // performing a stage 1 translation table walk. fail = FALSE; elsif hwupdatewalk then fail = !w; failedread = !iswrite; else fail = !r; failedread = !iswrite; if fail then domain = bits(4) UNKNOWN; secondstage = TRUE; return MemAttr_WTAArch64.PermissionFault; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_RA; else result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.attrs = MemAttr_NC; result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner.hints = MemHint_No; result.addrdesc.memattrs.shareable = TRUE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outershareable = TRUE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.tagged = FALSE; result.addrdesc.memattrs.outer = result.addrdesc.memattrs.inner; result.addrdesc.memattrs = MemAttrDefaults(result.addrdesc.memattrs); result.perms.ap = bits(3) UNKNOWN; result.perms.xn = '0'; result.perms.pxn = '0'; result.nG = bit UNKNOWN; result.contiguous = boolean UNKNOWN; result.domain = bits(4) UNKNOWN; result.level = integer UNKNOWN; result.blocksize = integer UNKNOWN; result.addrdesc.paddress.address = vaddress<51:0>; result.addrdesc.paddress.NS = if IsSecure() then '0' else '1'; result.addrdesc.fault =(ipaddress,NS, level, acctype, !failedread, secondstage, s2fs1walk); else return AArch64.NoFault(); return result;();

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/checksdebug/AArch64.AccessIsPrivilegedAArch64.CheckBreakpoint

// AArch64.AccessIsPrivileged() // ============================ // AArch64.CheckBreakpoint() // ========================= // Called before executing the instruction of length "size" bytes at "vaddress" in an AArch64 // translation regime, when either debug exceptions are enabled, or halting debug is enabled // and halting is allowed. booleanFaultRecord AArch64.AccessIsPrivileged(AArch64.CheckBreakpoint(bits(64) vaddress,AccType acctype) el =acctype, integer size) assert ! AArch64.AccessUsesELELUsingAArch32(acctype); if el ==( EL0S1TranslationRegime then ispriv = FALSE; elsif el ==()); assert ( EL3UsingAArch32 then ispriv = TRUE; elsif el ==() && size IN {2,4}) || size == 4; match = FALSE; for i = 0 to EL2UInt && (!(ID_AA64DFR0_EL1.BRPs) match_i =IsInHostAArch64.BreakpointMatch() || HCR_EL2.TGE == '0') then ispriv = TRUE; elsif(i, vaddress, acctype, size); match = match || match_i; if match && HaveUAOExtHaltOnBreakpointOrWatchpoint() && PSTATE.UAO == '1' then ispriv = TRUE; else ispriv = (acctype !=() then reason = ; Halt(reason); elsif match then acctype = AccType_IFETCH; iswrite = FALSE; return AArch64.DebugFault(acctype, iswrite); else return AArch64.NoFaultAccType_UNPRIVDebugHalt_Breakpoint); return ispriv;();

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/checksdebug/AArch64.AccessUsesELAArch64.CheckDebug

// AArch64.AccessUsesEL() // ====================== // Returns the Exception Level of the regime that will manage the translation for a given access type. // AArch64.CheckDebug() // ==================== // Called on each access to check for a debug exception or entry to Debug state. bits(2)FaultRecord AArch64.AccessUsesEL(AArch64.CheckDebug(bits(64) vaddress,AccType acctype) if acctype ==acctype, boolean iswrite, integer size) AccType_UNPRIVFaultRecord then returnfault = EL0AArch64.NoFault; elsif acctype ==(); d_side = (acctype != AccType_IFETCH); if HaveNV2Ext() && acctype == AccType_NV2REGISTER then return mask = '0'; generate_exception = AArch64.GenerateDebugExceptionsFrom(EL2, IsSecure(), mask) && MDSCR_EL1.MDE == '1'; else generate_exception = AArch64.GenerateDebugExceptions() && MDSCR_EL1.MDE == '1'; halt = HaltOnBreakpointOrWatchpoint(); if generate_exception || halt then if d_side then fault = AArch64.CheckWatchpoint(vaddress, acctype, iswrite, size); else fault = AArch64.CheckBreakpoint; else return PSTATE.EL;(vaddress, acctype, size); return fault;

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/checksdebug/AArch64.CheckPermissionAArch64.CheckWatchpoint

// AArch64.CheckPermission() // AArch64.CheckWatchpoint() // ========================= // Function used for permission checking from AArch64 stage 1 translations // Called before accessing the memory location of "size" bytes at "address", // when either debug exceptions are enabled for the access, or halting debug // is enabled and halting is allowed. FaultRecord AArch64.CheckPermission(AArch64.CheckWatchpoint(bits(64) vaddress,Permissions perms, bits(64) vaddress, integer level, bit NS, AccType acctype, boolean iswrite) acctype, boolean iswrite, integer size) assert !ELUsingAArch32(S1TranslationRegime()); wxn = match = FALSE; ispriv = SCTLR[].WXN == '1'; if (PSTATE.EL == EL0 || IsInHost() || (PSTATE.EL == EL1 && !HaveNV2Ext()) || (PSTATE.EL == EL1 && HaveNV2Ext() && (acctype != AccType_NV2REGISTER || !ELIsInHost(EL2)))) then priv_r = TRUE; priv_w = perms.ap<2> == '0'; user_r = perms.ap<1> == '1'; user_w = perms.ap<2:1> == '01'; ispriv = AArch64.AccessIsPrivileged(acctype); pan = if for i = 0 to HavePANExtUInt() then PSTATE.PAN else '0'; if ((ID_AA64DFR0_EL1.WRPs) match = match ||EL2EnabledAArch64.WatchpointMatch() && ((PSTATE.EL ==(i, vaddress, size, ispriv, acctype, iswrite); if match && EL1HaltOnBreakpointOrWatchpoint &&() then if acctype != HaveNVExtAccType_NONFAULT() && HCR_EL2.<NV, NV1> == '11') || (&& acctype !=HaveNV2ExtAccType_CNOTFIRST() && acctype ==then reason = AccType_NV2REGISTERDebugHalt_Watchpoint && HCR_EL2.NV2 == '1'))) then pan = '0'; is_ldst = !(acctype IN {;AccType_DCHalt,(reason); else // Fault will be reported and cancelled return AccType_DC_UNPRIVAArch64.DebugFault,(acctype, iswrite); elsif match then return AccType_ATAArch64.DebugFault, AccType_IFETCH}); is_ats1xp = (acctype == AccType_AT && AArch64.ExecutingATS1xPInstr()); if pan == '1' && user_r && ispriv && (is_ldst || is_ats1xp) then priv_r = FALSE; priv_w = FALSE; user_xn = perms.xn == '1' || (user_w && wxn); priv_xn = perms.pxn == '1' || (priv_w && wxn) || user_w; if ispriv then (r, w, xn) = (priv_r, priv_w, priv_xn); else (r, w, xn) = (user_r, user_w, user_xn); else // Access from EL2 or EL3 r = TRUE; w = perms.ap<2> == '0'; xn = perms.xn == '1' || (w && wxn); // Restriction on Secure instruction fetch if HaveEL(EL3) && IsSecure() && NS == '1' && SCR_EL3.SIF == '1' then xn = TRUE; if acctype == AccType_IFETCH then fail = xn; failedread = TRUE; elsif acctype IN { AccType_ATOMICRW, AccType_ORDEREDRW, AccType_ORDEREDATOMICRW } then fail = !r || !w; failedread = !r; elsif iswrite then fail = !w; failedread = FALSE; elsif acctype == AccType_DC && PSTATE.EL != EL0 then // DC maintenance instructions operating by VA, cannot fault from stage 1 translation, // other than DC IVAC, which requires write permission, and operations executed at EL0, // which require read permission. fail = FALSE; else fail = !r; failedread = TRUE; if fail then secondstage = FALSE; s2fs1walk = FALSE; ipaddress = bits(52) UNKNOWN; return AArch64.PermissionFault(ipaddress,boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, !failedread, secondstage, s2fs1walk); (acctype, iswrite); else return AArch64.NoFault();

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/checksfaults/AArch64.CheckS2PermissionAArch64.AccessFlagFault

// AArch64.CheckS2Permission() // =========================== // Function used for permission checking from AArch64 stage 2 translations // AArch64.AccessFlagFault() // ========================= FaultRecord AArch64.CheckS2Permission(AArch64.AccessFlagFault(bits(52) ipaddress,boolean NS, integer level,Permissions perms, bits(64) vaddress, bits(52) ipaddress, integer level, AccType acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean NS, boolean s2fs1walk, boolean hwupdatewalk) acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean secondstage, boolean s2fs1walk) assert ( extflag = bit UNKNOWN; errortype = bits(2) UNKNOWN; returnIsSecureEL2EnabledAArch64.CreateFaultRecord() || ((HaveELFault_AccessFlag(EL2) && !IsSecure() && !ELUsingAArch32(EL2))) && HasS2Translation(); r = perms.ap<1> == '1'; w = perms.ap<2> == '1'; if HaveExtendedExecuteNeverExt() then case perms.xn:perms.xxn of when '00' xn = FALSE; when '01' xn = PSTATE.EL == EL1; when '10' xn = TRUE; when '11' xn = PSTATE.EL == EL0; else xn = perms.xn == '1'; // Stage 1 walk is checked as a read, regardless of the original type if acctype == AccType_IFETCH && !s2fs1walk then fail = xn; failedread = TRUE; elsif (acctype IN { AccType_ATOMICRW, AccType_ORDEREDRW, AccType_ORDEREDATOMICRW }) && !s2fs1walk then fail = !r || !w; failedread = !r; elsif iswrite && !s2fs1walk then fail = !w; failedread = FALSE; elsif acctype == AccType_DC && PSTATE.EL != EL0 && !s2fs1walk then // DC maintenance instructions operating by VA, with the exception of DC IVAC, do // not generate Permission faults from stage 2 translation, other than when // performing a stage 1 translation table walk. fail = FALSE; elsif hwupdatewalk then fail = !w; failedread = !iswrite; else fail = !r; failedread = !iswrite; if fail then domain = bits(4) UNKNOWN; secondstage = TRUE; return AArch64.PermissionFault(ipaddress,NS, level, acctype, !failedread, secondstage, s2fs1walk); else return AArch64.NoFault();, ipaddress, NS, level, acctype, iswrite, extflag, errortype, secondstage, s2fs1walk);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/debugfaults/AArch64.CheckBreakpointAArch64.AddressSizeFault

// AArch64.CheckBreakpoint() // ========================= // Called before executing the instruction of length "size" bytes at "vaddress" in an AArch64 // translation regime, when either debug exceptions are enabled, or halting debug is enabled // and halting is allowed. // AArch64.AddressSizeFault() // ========================== FaultRecord AArch64.CheckBreakpoint(bits(64) vaddress,AArch64.AddressSizeFault(bits(52) ipaddress,boolean NS, integer level, AccType acctype, integer size) assert !acctype, boolean iswrite, boolean secondstage, boolean s2fs1walk) extflag = bit UNKNOWN; errortype = bits(2) UNKNOWN; returnELUsingAArch32AArch64.CreateFaultRecord(S1TranslationRegimeFault_AddressSize()); assert (UsingAArch32() && size IN {2,4}) || size == 4; match = FALSE; for i = 0 to UInt(ID_AA64DFR0_EL1.BRPs) match_i = AArch64.BreakpointMatch(i, vaddress, acctype, size); match = match || match_i; if match && HaltOnBreakpointOrWatchpoint() then reason = DebugHalt_Breakpoint; Halt(reason); elsif match then acctype = AccType_IFETCH; iswrite = FALSE; return AArch64.DebugFault(acctype, iswrite); else return AArch64.NoFault();, ipaddress, NS, level, acctype, iswrite, extflag, errortype, secondstage, s2fs1walk);

Library pseudocode for aarch64/translation/debugfaults/AArch64.CheckWatchpointAArch64.AsynchExternalAbort

// AArch64.CheckWatchpoint() // ========================= // Called before accessing the memory location of "size" bytes at "address", // when either debug exceptions are enabled for the access, or halting debug // is enabled and halting is allowed. // AArch64.AsynchExternalAbort() // ============================= // Wrapper function for asynchronous external aborts FaultRecord AArch64.CheckWatchpoint(bits(64) vaddress,AArch64.AsynchExternalAbort(boolean parity, bits(2) errortype, bit extflag) faulttype = if parity then AccTypeFault_AsyncParity acctype, boolean iswrite, integer size) assert !elseELUsingAArch32Fault_AsyncExternal(; ipaddress = bits(52) UNKNOWN; level = integer UNKNOWN; acctype =S1TranslationRegimeAccType_NORMAL()); ; iswrite = boolean UNKNOWN; secondstage = FALSE; s2fs1walk = FALSE; match = FALSE; ispriv = return AArch64.AccessIsPrivilegedAArch64.CreateFaultRecord(acctype); for i = 0 to UInt(ID_AA64DFR0_EL1.WRPs) match = match || AArch64.WatchpointMatch(i, vaddress, size, ispriv, acctype, iswrite); if match && HaltOnBreakpointOrWatchpoint() then if acctype != AccType_NONFAULT && acctype != AccType_CNOTFIRST then reason = DebugHalt_Watchpoint; Halt(reason); else // Fault will be reported and cancelled return AArch64.DebugFault(acctype, iswrite); elsif match then return AArch64.DebugFault(acctype, iswrite); else return AArch64.NoFault();(faulttype, ipaddress, boolean UNKNOWN, level, acctype, iswrite, extflag, errortype, secondstage, s2fs1walk);
